name: Country Cottage
sectionedDescription/description:
Country Cottage is located in scenic Southwest Virginia, it's a very private property with direct access to the Spearhead Trails Coal Canyon Trail! This cabin is quiet and perfect for nature lovers and riders with quick access to shopping and local restaurants. Sit on the porch and cookout with the outdoor grill and picnic table on property. This property offers privacy and security for your family as well as your vehicles & UTV's. Not only is it perfect for UTV enthusiasts but families as well!

We typically let guests do self check in, sometimes my husband does like to meet the guests if he’s available when they arrive. We are here should any issues occur.

The cabin is close to the town but still secluded, a 24 hour gas station and restaurants are very close by.

The driveway is steep, any guest with a trailer will need a 4 wheel drive. Any large trailer will need to park on the flat right below the driveway. A 4wd is typically preferred but many cars have made it with no trouble. During the winter months of snow/ice should be present, access to the cabin could be difficult but parking and walking up is an option that others have done. We just like to make guests aware before arrival so they use their judgement.

additionalHouseRules: Please do not wear/use any fragranced personal products (perfumed body sprays, colognes, lotions, shampoos, etc). It can be a real problem for both host and other guests who are migraine-prone or health sensitive. Also very hard for housekeeping to remove from linens. I provide fragrance-free shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, shave cream, lotion, and soap and deodorant that you're MORE than welcome to use!  If you have any questions, just ask. And if you need any other non-fragranced items (detergent, etc) just ask. NOTE: If your stay is over a Saturday, checkout is 9 a.m. Sunday, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed. The rules about goats, gates to use, feeding goats, etc., vary with the seasons. Just ask me.

name: Goat Haven Extra Wheel Room
photos/1/caption: Desk and chair and lamp
photos/2/caption: Half bath with toilet and sink
photos/4/caption: Raised sink in the half bath
photos/6/caption: A great day trip, and you can start anywhere along the route.
primaryHost/about:
Part of what made us want to be an Airbnb hosts is the wonderful hospitality we've known in our own travels.  As native Appalachians, my husband and I have a deep love for this region and its people and the tradition of hospitality.  We are both artists of sorts--I'm a freelance writer/reporter and he is a rock 'n roll keyboard player and works in the local school system. And we manage a herd of dairy goats, mostly LaMancha breed. All with names and personalities. Our place is about 15-20  minutes off off I-77. We're close to the notable "Back of the Dragon" motorcycle routes. And very close to some beautiful backroad bicycle routes. The scenery is beautiful all seasons of the year but especially the fall. We hope you'll visit!

 As for the goats, they are "the greatest entertainers and the greatest time wasters" as my dad used to say. He was a vet and built the house as a home and office. So it has a sort of historic/museum feel in certain sections. 

We don't guarantee food as part of our Airbnb listing,  but I love to cook and if I'm cooking, you're welcome to join us if you don't have other plans. 

Last but not least, we  love to know a little about our guests beforehand so PLEASE make sure you fill out the "Describe Yourself" questions under the Airbnb profile section to speed along the booking process.

Safe travels!
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to the piano/parlor room for relaxing. And the kitchen and dining areas cast shared space.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is one of my three listings. (Click my profile photo to see the other two.) This small roomis great if you're on a budget, and just need a place to lay your head for the night. It has a comfortable twin bed, a desk with tea and snack corner, and is right next to a bathroom. Please note it's only a half bath...it has a bidet toilet and sink but no shower. The bedroom gets south sun in the morning. (It also faces the road so you might hear some passing cars at night if you're a light sleeper)

Guests have access to the piano/parlor room for relaxing. And the kitchen and dining areas cast shared space.

I'm in and out of the shared spaces but your bed and bath are always private. I do enjoy interacting with guests but I'm also happy to leave you to your own privacy.

Please have the the Airbnb "describe yourself" profile questions filled out (type traveler you are, etc) before you request to book. Also, the local (county) occupancy tax is included in the room price and won't be collected when you arrive. Hope to see you soon!
sectionedDescription/houseRules: Please do not wear/use any fragranced personal products (perfumed body sprays, colognes, lotions, shampoos, etc). It can be a real problem for both host and other guests who are migraine-prone or health sensitive. Also very hard for housekeeping to remove from linens. I provide fragrance-free shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, shave cream, lotion, and soap and deodorant that you're MORE than welcome to use!  If you have any questions, just ask. And if you need any other non-fragranced items (detergent, etc) just ask. NOTE: If your stay is over a Saturday, checkout is 9 a.m. Sunday, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed. The rules about goats, gates to use, feeding goats, etc., vary with the seasons. Just ask me.
sectionedDescription/interaction: I'm in and out of the shared spaces but your bed and bath are always private. I do enjoy interacting with guests but I'm also happy to leave you to your own privacy.
sectionedDescription/notes: Please have the the Airbnb "describe yourself" profile questions filled out (type traveler you are, etc) before you request to book. Also, the local (county) occupancy tax is included in the room price and won't be collected when you arrive. Hope to see you soon!
sectionedDescription/summary: This is one of my three listings. (Click my profile photo to see the other two.) This small roomis great if you're on a budget, and just need a place to lay your head for the night. It has a comfortable twin bed, a desk with tea and snack corner, and is right next to a bathroom. Please note it's only a half bath...it has a bidet toilet and sink but no shower. The bedroom gets south sun in the morning. (It also faces the road so you might hear some passing cars at night if you're a light sleeper)

name: The Cottage Around the Corner
photos/0/caption: Welcome to The Cottage Around The Corner
photos/5/caption: The open kitchen/living room area has a 13' ceiling with an exposed beam and a beautiful chandelier, providing guests a large space to gather for dinner, watch a movie, or play a game.
photos/6/caption: The island in the kitchen is 6' long with a butcher block counter for prepping meals and extra seating for guests.
photos/9/caption: A 43  inch smart TV  provides entertainment by connecting to Netflix and other media streaming devices.
photos/10/caption: The kitchen has lots of storage and prep space. The stainless steel appliances are all new.
photos/12/caption: There is a good collection of pots and pans for cooking, an array of utensils, and dinnerware to serve all guests.
photos/13/caption: The kitchen has a coffee station with a Keurig machine and a variety of Kcups to fix your morning coffee and get your day off to a great start.
photos/15/caption: A variety of cups and glasses, an ice bucket, and beverage containers are on hand for guests.
photos/16/caption: Back door leading to the fenced area for outdoor grilling and fire pit.
photos/18/caption: Books, magazines, playing cards, and board games have been placed in the cottage for entertainment.
photos/20/caption: The home is equipped with a heat pump to provide a constant comfortable temperature year-round. The Ecobee Smart Thermostat uses touch screen technology that makes navigating the temperature easy.
photos/21/caption: Painted a warm yellow, this bedroom is sunny and bright during the day, but a restful night awaits guests with a queen-sized bed and a new memory foam mattress.
photos/22/caption: A desk equipped with office supplies and free wifi access provides travelers a comfortable space to work quietly.
photos/24/caption: This bedroom provides guests with a large walk-in closet for storage. Both twin beds have new memory foam mattresses.
photos/26/caption: The classic gray and white bathroom provides plenty of space to get ready in the morning. With a  tilting mirror and beautiful chrome industrial vanity lighting,  you are sure to look your best.
photos/27/caption: The ceramic tile floors are stunning and the bathtub/shower is surrounded by white subway tile and finished off with a rain shower fixture for plenty of water!
photos/30/caption: New for Summer 2023…Beautiful fenced yard with solar outdoor lights.
photos/31/caption: Stone and pea gravel complete the outdoor area with rocking chairs adorning the covered porch.
photos/32/caption: Fire pit with four Adirondack chairs. Wooden picnic table with 2 benches.
photos/34/caption: Welcome to the Cottage Around the Corner
primaryHost/about: My husband Joe and I were born and raised here in beautiful Washington County Virginia. We are Emory and Henry College Alumni and chose to continue to live and raise our children in the place we love. We know how special this region is and that is why we are excited to welcome you to our Cottage Around the Corner!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Right around the corner or right on the way, the Cottage Around the Corner is convenient for travelers. Whether visiting the beautiful mountains to bike or hike the Creeper Trail, sightseeing in the historical Abingdon or Bristol area, attending a game at E&H or just passing through to another destination, our goal is to provide a warm and welcoming home for your getaway. Resting on an acre of land and right off I 81 enjoy your stay in our cozy, country cottage.

The cottage sits on the corner of our family farm. It faces the road and is backed by open farmland. There is a private driveway for parking your car. A stone path leads from the driveway up 4 steps onto a covered porch. The front door has a keyless entry for your convenience. 

* The cottage entry is also accessible from a covered porch on the opposite side of the home with only one step off the grass. The entry door is not keyless. Please let us know if we can accommodate you with access.

When you enter the cottage, you will see that the living, kitchen, and dining area are open concept with a 13 ft. ceiling. We hope you will find this space warm and inviting with an exposed wood beam and large chandelier. The furniture is all new and carefully selected for the charm and most importantly comfort. There is a 43” Smart TV with Netflix in the living area and free Wi-Fi. The full kitchen area is truly open to the rest of the space and is equipped with everything you'd need to make delicious meals.

Entering the hallway from the living area, you will find the bathroom on the left. It features classic gray and white décor. The tub/shower is surrounded by subway wall tiles and a rain shower water fixture provides a great morning shower. The bathroom cabinets house enough towels, washcloths, bathmats, hairdryer, soap, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion for your stay at the cottage.

At the end of the hallway, double doors enclose the full-size washer and dryer. The laundry area also has an ironing board and iron, detergent, and dryer sheets.

The cottage has 2 separate bedrooms. Bedroom one is bright and sunny with a queen-size bed and a new memory foam mattress.  Bedroom two, painted a restful mountain blue has 2 twin-size beds and new memory foam mattresses. Both bedrooms are equipped with sheets, blankets, extra pillows, and luggage stands. There are closets in both bedrooms with plenty of storage and hangers for your clothing. There is also a portable crib available. 

With land surrounding the cottage and big trees providing shade, kids will enjoy playing outside, so bring your favorite outside games. There is a large covered porch with 2 rocking chairs. In the future, we plan to screen in the porch and add an outside entertainment area. 

Right off an interstate 81 exit, and 0.3 miles down the road our cottage is a very convenient location for just a one-night stay or an entire week or more. Please keep in mind that you will hear traffic noise from the interstate while outside. Extra construction measures were taken to provide a house that is quiet inside both day and night.

If you have special requests for your stay, just ask and we will try to accommodate.

Don’t miss it while you are here. Or come back if you do!

•	5 minutes to Emory & Henry College
•	5 minutes to The Salt Trail (bike riding or walking)
•	11 mins to Historic Abingdon (quaint shops, unique restaurants, and coffee shops), Barter Theatre, Abingdon Vineyards, Virginia Creeper Trail, Virginia Highlands Festival
•	15 mins to Damascus (Creeper Trail bike ride from White Top Mountain Station to Damascus)
•	22 mins to Hungry Mother Park/Lake, Marion VA 
•	30 mins to Bristol, VA-TN (variety of restaurants and shops, the Birthplace of Country Music Museum, Bristol Motor Speedway, Bristol Rhythm and Roots
sectionedDescription/houseRules: The cottage is primarily set up for small families and friends. We do not host wedding parties. The space is equipped with adequate supplies and intended only for the guests staying on the property.

additionalHouseRules:
Quiet time is between 10pm and 7am.
Cabin should be left in a clean manner. Excessively dirty cabins will be subject to additional cleaning fee. 
Please unload and park all atv's on the gravel at all times.
Absolutely no smoking inside cabins. If smoking is suspected you will be subject to a $150 fee to cover cleaning and deodorizing of cabin.
No grilling or cooking of any kind allowed on porches.
No illegal drugs of any kind allowed on property at any time.  allowed
Pets must be registered guests and under 30 lbs. Pets must be on leash at all  times outside. They must go with you on the trails or be crated in the cabin. Guests who leave dogs who bark constantly may be asked to leave with no refund.
Children must remain under adult supervision at all times.
Please place garbage in dumpster and wash your dishes before you leave. Also, please strip your beds linens and place in a pile somewhere in the cabin. Please place all used towels in a pile.
Cancellation Policy: We have a 30 day cancellation policy per cabin. If reservations are cancelled at least 30 days prior to your reservation date then a full refund will be given. If less than 30 days, then there will be no refund of your deposit unless we are able to rent the cabin(s) by the dates you originally reserved.  All cancellations will be charged $50 per cabin regardless of notification date. There will be no refunds for early departure.  If you have any further questions the just let us know.

primaryHost/about: We have been in the cabin rental business on the Hatfield McCoy Trails since October of 2007. Our guests are always satisfied and are usually return visitors.

sectionedDescription/description:
Wildwood Cabins sits right on the Guyandotte River and the views are amazing and peaceful. We are only 250 yards from trail 17 of the RockhousTrail and only five minutes from the grocery store, restaurants, and gas stations in downtown Gilbert. We can leave trail permits and maps in the cabin for you so there's no need to worry about running those down. Our cabins are very well kept and clean.

We live on property and are available if you need us.

photos/0/caption:
Kingdom Property presents
Frog and Nan's Place
photos/1/caption: All because two people fell in love. A young boy who walked in the rain without a coat met a church girl worth her weight in gold.  7 children, a coal mining career, and the rest is history.  He was the backbone and she was the heart of the family.

Bonita G. Brogdon-Mitchell, Owner

priceDetails/1/value: $25 per night after the first guest
primaryHost/about: Hello my name is Bonita G.  Brogdon-Mitchell.  I was born and raised in McDowell County of West Virginia.  I love the beautiful mountains and friendly people of Gary/Thorpe WV.  I am delighted to share a bit of our wealth of culture with any and all who visit.  I feel blessed to have lived in the majestic mountains of West Virginia and the sweet neighborhood in Thorpe WV.  Now I will share that blessing with you.

sectionedDescription/description: Bring the whole family to this great place with lots of room for fun.
sectionedDescription/summary: Bring the whole family to this great place with lots of room for fun.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #1 - The Litz Suite
sectionedDescription/description:
The Litz Mansion Room #1 - The Litz Suite

This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife Elizabeth during the Civil War. Following the war, Colonel Andrew Jackson May (“Jack”) purchased the home. Jack May was thought of as one of Tazewell County’s best known military heroes who played a significant role in the Civil War and helped retain control of the Virginia-Tennessee Railroad. May lived in the mansion with first wife Matilda May, who sadly passed away. Jack remarried Nelle Bly and had a son Colonel May. Nelle remained in the home and turned it into a school for a couple of years before it was sold to the longest owners on record, A.Z. Litz and wife Etta V. Stauber. 

While the mansion has changed ownership over the years, John Warfield Johnston’s home of grandeur remains the same over 160 years later! 

The Litz Mansion Room #1 - The Litz Suite

The Litz Suite pays homage to A.Z. Litz, in which the mansion as we know it today is named. The cozy bedroom features a queen-sized bed, fireplace, and most importantly a private on suite. The on suite is the main attraction here. Newly renovated with beautiful white tile, large glass shower, sunflower shower head and travertine corner seat, make this room a guest favorite. Located downstairs with easy access to the kitchen, dining room, living room and game room. Perfect for couples or guests that enjoy a little more privacy.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 2br ADA unit is TRAILSIDE to the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trails & Visitors Center at Coaldale, WV. Direct access to Pocahontas Spearhead Trail in VA. and to all Southern HMT Trails in WV, over 500 mi. On Rt 52 just 13 miles from I-77 exit 1.

Experience rustic charm with all the amenities of home in Four Wheeler Heaven's newest unit, The Miners Den! This two bedroom, one bathroom unit sleeps 6-8 people and is wheelchair accessible. When you walk in, you'll be greeted by rustic decor and historical photos from Mercer, McDowell and Tazewell counties, including photos of coal miners from our own family. The large living room TV and complimentary Wi-Fi provide plenty of entertainment after a long day's ride.

The Miners Den comes fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot — basically everything you need to get started. You can cook for your whole group with a full kitchen, including an oven/stove, microwave, full-size refrigerator/freezer, dishwasher, coffeemaker and crockpot. The Miners Den also has its own washer/dryer unit. Trust us - you'll need it after a day on the trails!

An oversized bathroom with an ADA accessible toilet and shower provides easy access to persons with disabilities. The master bedroom features a queen bed, closet, and its own private HD TV. The second bedroom is a bunk room with four Twin XL beds - perfect for the kids or other members of your group. The Miners Den also has a roll-out bed in the living room couch that can sleep up to 2 additional people, for a total capacity of 8.

There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers so you can be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. The bunk room shares a lock-out door with the Coaldale Condo, our original two bedroom, one bathroom unit that sleeps up to 5 people. Groups that rent both the Miners Den and Coaldale Condo will have a total of four bedrooms and two bathrooms with a capacity of 13 people. 

Ride all four southern Hatfield-McCoy trails: Pocahontas, Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek and Warrior. The Spearhead "Original Pocahontas" trail is a quick 4-mile ride up and over Coaldale Mountain Road. We also have a handy machine wash area on property and offer trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, FWH T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.

Ride your ATV or UTV right from our location to the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trailhead just 100 yards away!

name: Conveniently located Apartment - Pipestem /Concord
photos/1/caption: Living space.
primaryHost/about:
Hello - I own and operate Prime Capital Properties, which offers homes and apartments near Concord University in Athens, West Virginia.  During the Summer, we have several empty apartments that we provide a safe place and a bed for a reasonable price, and you do the rest!  
Wherever you stay, we are just a few blocks away at any time.  I'm a world traveler myself and try to use my passport at least once a year!
sectionedDescription/access: You will have access to the entire efficiency apartment.
sectionedDescription/description:
This small 340 Square Foot apartment will do great for your sleeping arrangements.  There's no TV, so get out and explore Wild and Wonderful West Virginia!  Located in Athens WV, Home of Concord University, and just a short drive to Pipestem, Bluestone lake, and historic Hinton WV.  One twin and one full bed are provided, both were changed in 2019.  CANNOT be occupied by more than 2 persons.  Remodeled 2010, new carpet 2018.  Features fridge, stove, microwave, full bathtub with shower.

Due to local regulations, this unit may not be occupied by more than 2 persons.  If you are coming for an event at the local university in Athens, walk out the back door to the adjoining university property.  This unit is located in an apartment building with 3 other occupied apartments with quiet people, and respect for our other guests is mandatory.  Short drive to Princeton, Pipestem and many other attractions.

You will have access to the entire efficiency apartment.

Please text me if you have any questions!

Feel free to walk around the neighborhood.  Adjacent to the US Post Office just a few minute walk, a small park contains a sign marking the "Athens Concord Trails", these include a mixture of on and off campus trails mapped out around the local area.  In town, we have CVS as our chain pharmacy, Dollar General as the local chain store, and Ginos as the chain restaurant.  Moe's is a local restaurant next door to the gas station with great reviews and a full menu of many types of food, and lots of comfort food options.

You may park on the street directly in front of the building.  When you enter the front door, the apartment is directly to the right.

You may park on the street directly in front of the building.  When you enter the front door, the apartment is directly to the right.

sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Feel free to walk around the neighborhood.  Adjacent to the US Post Office just a few minute walk, a small park contains a sign marking the "Athens Concord Trails", these include a mixture of on and off campus trails mapped out around the local area.  In town, we have CVS as our chain pharmacy, Dollar General as the local chain store, and Ginos as the chain restaurant.  Moe's is a local restaurant next door to the gas station with great reviews and a full menu of many types of food, and lots of comfort food options.
sectionedDescription/notes: You may park on the street directly in front of the building.  When you enter the front door, the apartment is directly to the right.
sectionedDescription/space: Due to local regulations, this unit may not be occupied by more than 2 persons.  If you are coming for an event at the local university in Athens, walk out the back door to the adjoining university property.  This unit is located in an apartment building with 3 other occupied apartments with quiet people, and respect for our other guests is mandatory.  Short drive to Princeton, Pipestem and many other attractions.
sectionedDescription/summary: This small 340 Square Foot apartment will do great for your sleeping arrangements.  There's no TV, so get out and explore Wild and Wonderful West Virginia!  Located in Athens WV, Home of Concord University, and just a short drive to Pipestem, Bluestone lake, and historic Hinton WV.  One twin and one full bed are provided, both were changed in 2019.  CANNOT be occupied by more than 2 persons.  Remodeled 2010, new carpet 2018.  Features fridge, stove, microwave, full bathtub with shower.
sectionedDescription/transit: You may park on the street directly in front of the building.  When you enter the front door, the apartment is directly to the right.

sectionedDescription/description:
Hi.  We offer COZY rooms with a BEAUTIFUL view of GREAT Smoky mountains surrounding our property.  KIND and FRIENDLY hosts ready to WELCOME all your needs.

THANK YOU

We are providing a room with two beds or one bed as guests need, in a hotel setting, close to the interstate, providing an easy stopover for our guests traveling along the I-81 and I-77 corridors.  A mexican restaurant, a local barbeque place, and an American diner are nearby for dining options.  A vineyard, an animal park, and New River Trails nearby and a short drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Big Walker Lookout for nature lovers.

Guests will need their car.

our pet fee is $15 per night
Smoking rooms available for $20 more (based on availability).
Smoking in a non smoking room will incur a $150 incidental fee.

name: Welcoming place for Hatfield & McCoy Trail Riders.
photos/0/caption: If you prefer a firmer bed, this room is for you.
primaryHost/about: Live in Florida when not in WV. Dog owner of 1 Terrier named Leo.
sectionedDescription/access: Concrete pavement for parking your vehicle. There is no public transportation so you will need a private vehicle to get around. Your smartphone's GPS won't work in the general area. Nearest restaurants and shops are about 15 minutes away. This hideaway is in the general area of the Hatfield and McCoy Trails.
sectionedDescription/description:
Cozy country home with large wrap around porch. Wake up sit and swing on front porch while having your morning coffee. Enjoy the sound of the creek flowing by house. Free Wi-Fi, cable and smart TV for all your streaming needs. Turn on the Wi-Fi calling feature on your cell phone while at a cellphone coverage area to make and receive calls during your stay. Close to outlaw trails at Hell Creek, 4 miles from Delbarton and Buffalo Trail heads.

Clean, friendly and safe. I have 2 rooms on here so if both rooms are booked you may have to share public spaces. However, you will have your own room and bath. Access to washer and dryer, as well as kitchen for long-staying guests. Please no sleeping on living room furniture

Concrete pavement for parking your vehicle. There is no public transportation so you will need a private vehicle to get around. Your smartphone's GPS won't work in the general area. Nearest restaurants and shops are about 15 minutes away. This hideaway is in the general area of the Hatfield and McCoy Trails.

I like to give guests their privacy but available if needed. Sometimes I may be out of town and my Aunt will be available next door if needed

This is a quiet and remote area. Restaurants and shops are about 15min away.

You will need a car no public transportation. Your smartphone's GPS won't work so follow these directions.

Directions:

Coming from Charleston side (North) on US-119, make a left on WV-65 towards Delbarton. Drive for about 3 miles until you see a 2-storey log house with blue tin roof on the left. Make a left at the bridge on Pearl Hill Rd. Drive straight, don't take the road over the railroad. Make a left on State St. You'll end at the red gate where the house is. 

Coming from Williamson/ side (South) on US-119, make a right instead and follow the same direction from WV-65 to Delbarton.

Coming from Delbarton on WV-65, drive until you pass the Coal Mines on the right.  About 1/4 mile, you will see a 2-storey log house with blue tin roof on the right. Turn right at the bridge on Pearl Hill Rd. Drive straight, don't take the road over the railroad. Make a left on State St. You'll end at the red gate where the house is.

If you turn it on please turn off when leaving.

We hope you enjoy our fun sized cabin and simply ask that you clean-up after yourself by placing trash in the trash can provided, wash dishes, and place laundry in the hamper provided.  If you bring a dog, please clean-up after your dog and should you opt to leave your animal alone, please leave them in a crate in order to deter damage to our cabins.  
*Smoking is allowed in outside areas where sand buckets are placed for cigarette butts.

name: Richmond’s Meadow Creek Hideaway Cabin #4
p3SummaryAddress: Meadow Creek, West Virginia, United States

photos/14/caption: Outside

primaryHost/about: Welcome to Richmond's Meadow Creek Hideaway.  My husband & I have owned our small vacation rental business for 15 years.  We own a full size cottage on the riverfront along with a separate garage Apartment.  Both are open year round.  From April to October, we have three cedar sided cabins also available for rental.  All of our properties are located in the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve, Summers County, West Virginia.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Our Cabin has free parking, a large wooden deck with a propane grill, a fire pit out back and firewood too.
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to Cabin #4, our fun sized hunting themed cabin.  Our cabin is 120 sf, roughly the size of a standard bedroom.  It has a loft with a full size futon mattress, a roll-up pillow top mat, (perfect for a child to sleep on), a futon sofa/bed, kitchenette, bath with shower, and a large deck.  The Cabin is fully furnished, has ac/heating, satellite tv, Wifi, and both a fire pit and wood. This cabin is open seasonally April through October yearly.

Our fun sized Cabin #4is located in the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve, three miles off I-64 at Meadow Creek.  We are a short drive to historic Hinton, WV, Lewisburg, White Sulphur Springs, and Fayetteville, WV.  

We are 4/10s of a mile from public access to the New River and to the Meadow Creek stream.

Our Cabin has free parking, a large wooden deck with a propane grill, a fire pit out back and firewood too.

My husband and I live in Meadow Creek and can be available as needed.

Our Cabins are located in the New River Gorge National Park at Meadow Creek.  We are an easy access to I-64.  Nearby attractions include the New, Greenbrier and Bluestone Rivers, Sandstone Visitors Center, Bluestone Lake, Pipestem State Park, Bluestone State Park, historic Hinton, WV, Lewisburg, White Sulphur Springs and Fayetteville, WV, and Winterplace Ski Resort.

Personal transportation.

Our Cabin is fully furnished with all linens, a coffee pot, microwave, toaster oven, dish ware, satellite tv and ac.

As Meadow Creek is a small railroad community, trains travel through Meadow Creek on no certain schedule.  You will hear the trains as well as their whistle.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
We hope you enjoy our fun sized cabin and simply ask that you clean-up after yourself by placing trash in the trash can provided, wash dishes, and place laundry in the hamper provided.  If you bring a dog, please clean-up after your dog and should you opt to leave your animal alone, please leave them in a crate in order to deter damage to our cabins.  
*Smoking is allowed in outside areas where sand buckets are placed for cigarette butts.

additionalHouseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out please contact (304)-589-5789
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee per pet. We will send you a request for additional pet fees. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

sectionedDescription/description:
FULLY FURNISHED EXECUTIVE RENTAL ~ ALL UTILITIES AND WI-FI INCLUDED!

Everything you need in one place!

Are you looking for a nightly rental that’s just as comfortable as your own home?

If so, you have found the right place!

FULLY FURNISHED EXECUTIVE RENTAL ~ Bluewell

ALL UTILITIES AND WI-FI INCLUDED!

Everything you need in one place!
Are you looking for a nightly rental that’s just as comfortable as your own home?
If so, you have found the right place!

This rental has a queen bed in the bedroom. Towels and washcloths are included for four guests.

It was just remodeled with brand new paint throughout, a new central heating and air HVAC unit, new bedding, new flooring, and more! This rental includes a complete kitchen with all of the necessities, from pots and pans down to silverware, and a full-size stove & refrigerator. We have supplied everything down to the hangers to hang your clothes on inside of the full-sized closet with dressers in the bedroom. There is a Smart TV in the living room and the bedroom, with a DVD player at each TV to watch your favorite Red Box movies on.

It is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants such as Dollar General, Gino’s Pizza, to a local favorite ‘Lynn’s Drive-In Restaurant’, a gas station, Advanced Auto, and even a laundromat. Razor and ATV riding is legal on all streets in this town. You can park your truck and trailer in the parking lot and ride straight to the trails. Great cell service, FREE Wi-Fi, and it is only a short ride to all of the trail systems.

Side Note: You will have to go down steps to get to this one-bedroom apartment style nightly rental.

FREE on site parking is available at the property

Contactless check in and check out is a must. You are emailed your door code the day of check in and once inside you have an extra security door lock.

	3PM check-in & 11AM check-out. Early check-in and late check-out may
        be available for an additional fee.
	2-night minimum stay required which will include all of the luxuries you have in your own home.
	PETS WELCOMED! $100 non-refundable pet fee will be required though due to the extensive deep cleaning conducted after a pet has visited.

sectionedDescription/description:
Full bath, Queen bed, flat screen TV (dish), free wi-fi. Private entrance. Very safe area. We are located between Abingdon Va. and St. Paul Va. on highway 58.

This rental is in a separate part of our home and offers total privacy. The bed is a queen size so space will only accommodate two adults comfortably. There is one full bath and a small kitchen. The home sits on an acre of property and joins several vacant acres in behind.

The property is fenced in however there is a private entrance with deck, for the space. The entrance is located outside of the fenced in area. The area is safe so I will leave the door open and the key on the table. There is no protocol for checking in, so you may access the space when you arrive. Parking is in front of the steps leading up to the space. Please don't park in front of garage doors. Thanks so much.

We are always available to our guests to answer questions about the area or to resolve any issues that might occur with the space. You will be provided with our cell and house phone numbers in the event that you need anything, otherwise you will have total privacy.

Quite neighborhood with two miles of walking trails, through the woods, on our property.
In St. Paul, Va. just about 7 miles away is the Sugar Hills ATV and hiking trails, and the newly remodeled "Western Front" with a nice Restaurant. Sugar Hill Brewery is also a great place to eat and experience local beer. 
The Hidden Valley Lake Area offers hiking, boating and fishing, and is just a few miles away. Fifteen- twenty miles away is The Channels, a majestic sandstone formation that is over 400-million years old. Great Hike !  The "Devils Bath Tub" is not to far away and a must see. The Pinnacle Natural Area Reserve is also very close and quite spectacular. The town of Abingdon (18 miles away) is a great little town with some excellent restaurants,  Wolf Hills Brewing Company, The Creeper Trail, The Barter Theater (state theater of Virginia!), biking and walking trails, festivals, and much more.

Please check location of the property before booking. 
Thanks

For guests that will be using the space for extended time periods, we laundry the bed linens, towels and wash cloths once per week.  We do not clean the space or wash the linens with synthetic perfumed products.   We ask that you do not use room deodorizers, incense or scented candles in the space.  We also ask that you use colognes and perfumes sparingly.  We strive to use all natural products for cleaning, laundering and sanitizing to provide for the comfort and safety of our guests and our cleaning crew. Thanks so much for you cooperation.

name: Raven Ridge Lodge spectacular views
photos/0/caption: Raven Ridge Lodge - Enjoy a birds eye view of nature.
photos/1/caption: The view from Raven Ridge.
photos/14/caption: Unique furnishings.
photos/15/caption: Top of the world!
primaryHost/about: I am a carpenter and furniture maker currently working doing land conservation in the mountains I love. I live on 500 acres on Clinch Mountain. I love music and travel.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Raven Ridge is a unique and wonderful retreat in a spectacular setting. My guests tell me my photos don't do justice to the mountain top. Come and see for yourself!

Please note - Due to the coronavirus I am leaving 1 day between reservations for my safety and the safety of my guests. 
 
Raven Ridge is a mountain top retreat in a natural rhododendron and azalea garden on 100 acres with spectacular views of three states. Spectacular spring blooms and wonderful leaf viewing in the fall. Borders and overlooks the 4,800 acre Channels State Forest. The Clinch Mountain Hiking Trail crosses the property, with access to the Channels, a unique rock formation on top of Clinch Mountain that is a popular hiking destination. The property is listed on the Virginia Birding and wildlife trail, with abundant wildlife and excellent birding. Raven Ridge is located just off the Trans America 76 cross county bike route.

 The Lodge has two bedrooms with queen beds and a couch that converts to a full bed in the living area. The kitchen is fully equipped with a six burner deluxe range. The  marble tiled bath includes a claw foot bathtub. There is an outside hot tub available for soaking under the stars. Heat is provided by a soapstone wood stove with glass doors. In the colder months, the beds are made up with electric blankets to keep you cozy and warm. Numerous porches are great for viewing the scenery or just lounging around.

Although the property has a Saltville address, it is actually located north of the town of Abingdon, and southwest of Lebanon.

Please note that in case of light snow,  a four wheel drive vehicle is recommended for access. If there is a heavy snow (more than a couple of inches), access may not be possible. We don't get a lot of snow, but it is always possible in the winter months. All that being said, Raven Ridge is incredibly beautiful in the snow. 

There is a two night minimum stay. Sorry, pets are not allowed at Raven Ridge, due to the allergies of some of my guests. Although my standard check in time is after 3 PM, I can sometimes accommodate earlier check in.  depending on my schedule. Late checkout may be available as well. 
.

Foreign guests are welcome!
sectionedDescription/houseRules: All guest will be required to sign a waiver of liability for use of the property due to the unique character of Raven Ridge.
sectionedDescription/notes: Foreign guests are welcome!

name: Private getaway in downtown Abingdon
primaryHost/about: Adventuring through life. We use Airbnb for most of our trips, traveling with our kids or on getaways. Always choosing happiness and now enjoying hosting our own place to pass on the beauty of this community.
sectionedDescription/access: You have the whole apartment to yourself, along with a small yard and patio for you to enjoy.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is an apartment with a private entrance in downtown Abingdon. Within walking distance to restaurants, The Creeper Trail, Main st., Barter theatre and all Abingdon has to offer! You have your own private patio and yard. Pet friendly for your perfect weekend visit to Abingdon and all it has to offer. We offer smart TV, Wifi, washer/dryer and fully stocked kitchen. With bright decor, this is a darling cozy spot for your stay.

This is a private apartment in a small apartment building right in Downtown Abingdon. You have your own private entrance. Parking available right in front of your door on the street. The patio has seating with a small yard. We provide everything you need for a comfortable and private get away! Pets are welcome. There is a $35 pet fee per pet that we will charge via Airbnb on day of arrival. This is a fully furnished unit. Smart TV in the bedroom and the living room.

You have the whole apartment to yourself, along with a small yard and patio for you to enjoy.

Right on Valley St. This is a perfect location. Walking distance to the heart of Abingdon. And beautiful streets to walk/run if that’s what you would like! Don’t forget to stop at our famous Abingdon Farmers Market. It usually runs Saturdays and Tuesday afternoons in the summer. You can walk to Barter Theatre, Restaurants and antique stores all along Main st. This is a very safe street and neighborhood in downtown Abingdon.

Bikes. Walking. And of course a car :) Virginia Creeper Trial Bike Shop is located in town and offers bike rentals.

We will provide a grill for your enjoyment during the summer months. This has an efficient heat and air mini split system. Please read our Abingdon guide book for great recommendations on restaurants and things to do during your stay! There is a $35 pet fee per pet that will be charged to you via Airbnb on the day of arrival. There is a washer and dryer along with extra bedding if needed. The couch is a comfortable full size couch able to sleep one person. Parking is available on the street in front of the building or beside the building.

-No shoes in the house would be greatly appreciated.
-May not be suitable for toddlers or small children. There is no door or safety gate at the top of the stairs which could be hazardous for small children. There are no special child safety features or childcare items (e.g. crib, playpen) provided. There are no railings on the front porch to prevent anyone from falling off.
-Please make sure both doors to the cabin are locked and also the cable gate for the driveway must be locked upon checkout.

Guests agree to read, understand and adhere to the Liability Waiver and house rules.

Liability Waiver:
You understand that renting this Appalachian Mountain cabin with stairs, uneven outside ground, and porch without railings in an area with bears, skunks,  poisonous snakes, ticks carrying lyme disease, large rocks, and anything else associated with this house is at your own risk. You understand there are special dangers present to children who are not carefully supervised, and to any person with health risks, or if intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medication, or while pregnant. You understand the risks discussed above and agree to assume all responsibility for yourself, your property, and for those in your party. You and all guests in your party agree to waive any claim whatsoever against owner for accidents or claims arising from all activities and circumstances associated with renting this house. All guests in your party acknowledge and agree that they have read and understand this waiver and they acknowledge that renting this home constitutes a binding and enforceable contract between Airbnb Guests and property owner.

name: Secluded Blue Ridge Mountaintop Getaway
photos/1/caption: Cabin
photos/13/caption: More Views from the cabin
photos/14/caption: Walking Path behind the Cabin
photos/15/caption: Behind the Cabin
photos/16/caption: Behind the Cabin

photos/23/caption: New River Trail State Park -- Bridge over the New River near Fries Junction
photos/24/caption: New River Trail State Park -- Bridge over New River near Fries Junction

photos/26/caption: New River Trail State Park -- Chestnut Creek Falls

photos/29/caption: Mabry Mill off the Blue Ridge Parkway
sectionedDescription/access: Entire cabin, picnic shelter, and property is yours for the length of your stay.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy a relaxing vacation in our secluded mountaintop cabin getaway. Tucked away in the Blue Ridge Mountains bordering Jefferson National Forest, this cabin is a cozy retreat with dynamite panoramic views. Spend your time sitting on the porch swing overlooking the Appalachian Mountain countryside. Glimpse the four highest peaks in Virginia, watch the hawks and eagles soar at eye level, and enjoy nature at its best.

Inside the cabin, you will find: 
-A small but fully outfitted kitchen with refrigerator, stove, oven, microwave, toaster, coffeemaker, dishes, utensils, pots and pans.
-Living room with flat screen TV connected to Dish Network satellite with all the network stations as well as Showtime, Cinemax, Starz, and many more.
-Unfortunately, we DO NOT provide internet at this time. However cell phone reception and data usage is confirmed to work well for U.S. Cellular and Verizon plans. (We do not have any knowledge of how well other carriers will work at this time.)
-One full bathroom with shower and washer/dryer located on the ground floor adjacent to the kitchen.
-Heating via baseboard heat.
-Upstairs there are two small bedroom spaces; one bedroom with queen bed and the other bedroom with two twin beds. There are NO DOORS separating the bedrooms from each other or the staircase.
-We will provide a starter amount of toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags, dish soap, hand soap, and shampoo, however for longer stays you may need to purchase additional supplies.

Outside the cabin, you will find:
-Front porch with swing and two rocking chairs.
-Picnic shelter with picnic table and gas barbecue grill.
-Forested walking path along the ridge behind the cabin.
-Scenic views of the countryside.  You may spot some of the local wildlife including white tailed deer, wild turkey, raccoons, possums, hawks, and eagles. Although not as commonly seen, black bears, coyote, foxes, and snakes also live in the area.

Also of note:
-The drive to the property is somewhat of an adventure in of itself. You will be driving through curvy rural farmland roads with livestock including cows, sheep, horses, goats, and chickens in various fields. Please be cautious while driving; it is very common for livestock and/or wildlife to be in the road! You will be on paved road for the majority of the trip, but toward the end, this changes to a one lane gravel road as you climb up the mountain. The driveway to the cabin is steep, so we recommend front wheel or 4-wheel drive vehicles.
-During winter months, reservations may be subject to cancellation due to safety concerns in the event of snow or ice on the road.
-There are 4 steps up to the front porch, and there are 13 somewhat narrow steps inside up to the second floor bedrooms.
-There is a cable gate (essentially a cable across the driveway) with combination padlock at the driveway entrance and keypad self check-in on the front door. (We will provide the codes and detailed driving directions prior to your stay. We strongly recommend you print this information prior to driving since there may be areas of spotty cell service.)

Entire cabin, picnic shelter, and property is yours for the length of your stay.

I give my guests their space and privacy, but am readily available by cell phone for texting or calls.

The town of Fries (pronounced "freeze") is about 15-20 minutes away from the cabin, along with two nearby access points for the New River Trail. The New River Trail State Park is a linear park running 57 miles including 39 miles that parallels the scenic and historic New River along what had previously been a railroad track. The trail is relatively flat and includes trestle bridges, tunnels, small waterfalls, and other beautiful woodland scenery enjoyable to hikers, bikers, and horseback riders of all ages.

The nearest stores for groceries and supplies would be the Star Market (~15 minutes) and Dollar General Store (~20 minutes) in Fries, VA. There are larger grocery stores and a Super Wal-Mart located in Galax, VA (~35 minutes). We would recommend picking up supplies on your way to the cabin to save time.

About 20 minutes away, across from one of the more scenic New River Trail access points, you will find "New River Outdoor Adventures." This is a local company that provides shuttle services and rentals for canoes, kayaks, tubes, biking, fishing, etc. They also sell live bait and tackle for all your fishing needs, as well as fishing and hunting licenses (either short or long term). If you call (276)237-TUBE(8823) they will customize whatever adventure you might want for your group.

The city of Galax is about a 30 minute drive. Within Galax, you will find many restaurants, fast food options, antique stores, a quaint walkable downtown area, a small movie theater, bowling alley, and of course Super Wal-Mart, among other amenities.

Galax also happens to be home to the largest and oldest running Old Time Bluegrass Fiddler’s Convention, which takes place annually in August since 1935. But don't worry, the entire Appalachian region is known for Bluegrass and traditional "old-timey" music which can be enjoyed year-round. The Rex Theater in Galax, VA hosts weekly live music and other special events. The Fries historic theater in Fries, VA also hosts weekly Thursday night Bluegrass "jam sessions" and other special events. The wonderful Blue Ridge Music Center can be found on the Blue Ridge Parkway at Milepost 213. This facility includes a large outdoor amphitheater with summer concert series, an award winning music museum of old-time music, and daily display of free music from local musicians.

Access to the Blue Ridge Parkway is only 22 miles away, or about a 35 minute drive. The Blue Ridge Parkway runs 469 miles through Virginia and North Carolina and is one of the most visited properties of the National Park System. The Parkway offers something for everyone including scenic drives, mountain views, biking/hiking/equestrian trails, waterfalls and swimming holes, historic farmsteads and museums, cultural exhibits, and much more.

Grayson Highlands State Park is a longer trek, about 45 miles (or ~70 minutes) drive away from the cabin. This park serves as gateway to the state’s highest peak, Mount Rogers, as well as the Appalachian Trail and the Grayson Highlands. The park offers hiking trails, biking trails, horse riding trails, bouldering, fishing, boating, and the chance to encounter wild ponies.

Previous guests have reported good cellular service at the cabin with Verizon, AT&T, Sprint, and US Cellular.  There is no internet service, but there is Dish Network TV  with many channels to choose from.

Guests agree to read, understand and adhere to the Liability Waiver and house rules.

Liability Waiver:
You understand that renting this Appalachian Mountain cabin with stairs, uneven outside ground, and porch without railings in an area with bears, skunks,  poisonous snakes, ticks carrying lyme disease, large rocks, and anything else associated with this house is at your own risk. You understand there are special dangers present to children who are not carefully supervised, and to any person with health risks, or if intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medication, or while pregnant. You understand the risks discussed above and agree to assume all responsibility for yourself, your property, and for those in your party. You and all guests in your party agree to waive any claim whatsoever against owner for accidents or claims arising from all activities and circumstances associated with renting this house. All guests in your party acknowledge and agree that they have read and understand this waiver and they acknowledge that renting this home constitutes a binding and enforceable contract between Airbnb Guests and property owner.
sectionedDescription/interaction: I give my guests their space and privacy, but am readily available by cell phone for texting or calls.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie:
The town of Fries (pronounced "freeze") is about 15-20 minutes away from the cabin, along with two nearby access points for the New River Trail. The New River Trail State Park is a linear park running 57 miles including 39 miles that parallels the scenic and historic New River along what had previously been a railroad track. The trail is relatively flat and includes trestle bridges, tunnels, small waterfalls, and other beautiful woodland scenery enjoyable to hikers, bikers, and horseback riders of all ages.

The nearest stores for groceries and supplies would be the Star Market (~15 minutes) and Dollar General Store (~20 minutes) in Fries, VA. There are larger grocery stores and a Super Wal-Mart located in Galax, VA (~35 minutes). We would recommend picking up supplies on your way to the cabin to save time.

About 20 minutes away, across from one of the more scenic New River Trail access points, you will find "New River Outdoor Adventures." This is a local company that provides shuttle services and rentals for canoes, kayaks, tubes, biking, fishing, etc. They also sell live bait and tackle for all your fishing needs, as well as fishing and hunting licenses (either short or long term). If you call (276)237-TUBE(8823) they will customize whatever adventure you might want for your group.

The city of Galax is about a 30 minute drive. Within Galax, you will find many restaurants, fast food options, antique stores, a quaint walkable downtown area, a small movie theater, bowling alley, and of course Super Wal-Mart, among other amenities.

Galax also happens to be home to the largest and oldest running Old Time Bluegrass Fiddler’s Convention, which takes place annually in August since 1935. But don't worry, the entire Appalachian region is known for Bluegrass and traditional "old-timey" music which can be enjoyed year-round. The Rex Theater in Galax, VA hosts weekly live music and other special events. The Fries historic theater in Fries, VA also hosts weekly Thursday night Bluegrass "jam sessions" and other special events. The wonderful Blue Ridge Music Center can be found on the Blue Ridge Parkway at Milepost 213. This facility includes a large outdoor amphitheater with summer concert series, an award winning music museum of old-time music, and daily display of free music from local musicians.

Access to the Blue Ridge Parkway is only 22 miles away, or about a 35 minute drive. The Blue Ridge Parkway runs 469 miles through Virginia and North Carolina and is one of the most visited properties of the National Park System. The Parkway offers something for everyone including scenic drives, mountain views, biking/hiking/equestrian trails, waterfalls and swimming holes, historic farmsteads and museums, cultural exhibits, and much more.

Grayson Highlands State Park is a longer trek, about 45 miles (or ~70 minutes) drive away from the cabin. This park serves as gateway to the state’s highest peak, Mount Rogers, as well as the Appalachian Trail and the Grayson Highlands. The park offers hiking trails, biking trails, horse riding trails, bouldering, fishing, boating, and the chance to encounter wild ponies.
sectionedDescription/notes: Previous guests have reported good cellular service at the cabin with Verizon, AT&T, Sprint, and US Cellular.  There is no internet service, but there is Dish Network TV  with many channels to choose from.
sectionedDescription/space:
Inside the cabin, you will find: 
-A small but fully outfitted kitchen with refrigerator, stove, oven, microwave, toaster, coffeemaker, dishes, utensils, pots and pans.
-Living room with flat screen TV connected to Dish Network satellite with all the network stations as well as Showtime, Cinemax, Starz, and many more.
-Unfortunately, we DO NOT provide internet at this time. However cell phone reception and data usage is confirmed to work well for U.S. Cellular and Verizon plans. (We do not have any knowledge of how well other carriers will work at this time.)
-One full bathroom with shower and washer/dryer located on the ground floor adjacent to the kitchen.
-Heating via baseboard heat.
-Upstairs there are two small bedroom spaces; one bedroom with queen bed and the other bedroom with two twin beds. There are NO DOORS separating the bedrooms from each other or the staircase.
-We will provide a starter amount of toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags, dish soap, hand soap, and shampoo, however for longer stays you may need to purchase additional supplies.

Outside the cabin, you will find:
-Front porch with swing and two rocking chairs.
-Picnic shelter with picnic table and gas barbecue grill.
-Forested walking path along the ridge behind the cabin.
-Scenic views of the countryside.  You may spot some of the local wildlife including white tailed deer, wild turkey, raccoons, possums, hawks, and eagles. Although not as commonly seen, black bears, coyote, foxes, and snakes also live in the area.

Also of note:
-The drive to the property is somewhat of an adventure in of itself. You will be driving through curvy rural farmland roads with livestock including cows, sheep, horses, goats, and chickens in various fields. Please be cautious while driving; it is very common for livestock and/or wildlife to be in the road! You will be on paved road for the majority of the trip, but toward the end, this changes to a one lane gravel road as you climb up the mountain. The driveway to the cabin is steep, so we recommend front wheel or 4-wheel drive vehicles.
-During winter months, reservations may be subject to cancellation due to safety concerns in the event of snow or ice on the road.
-There are 4 steps up to the front porch, and there are 13 somewhat narrow steps inside up to the second floor bedrooms.
-There is a cable gate (essentially a cable across the driveway) with combination padlock at the driveway entrance and keypad self check-in on the front door. (We will provide the codes and detailed driving directions prior to your stay. We strongly recommend you print this information prior to driving since there may be areas of spotty cell service.)
sectionedDescription/summary: Enjoy a relaxing vacation in our secluded mountaintop cabin getaway. Tucked away in the Blue Ridge Mountains bordering Jefferson National Forest, this cabin is a cozy retreat with dynamite panoramic views. Spend your time sitting on the porch swing overlooking the Appalachian Mountain countryside. Glimpse the four highest peaks in Virginia, watch the hawks and eagles soar at eye level, and enjoy nature at its best.

additionalHouseRules:
1. No parties or events may be held at the Loft or on the property. 
2. No overnight guests other than those registered and approved when making the reservation online. If you are expecting visitors for a short period of time during your stay, please let your hosts know.
3. No pets are permitted without prior permission and with an additional pet charge of $25 per pet (maximum one large dog or two small dogs). Sorry, no cats are permitted ever. We have four (friendly) dogs so we will need to coordinate yard usage to avoid any possible problems. Please clean up after your pet! Pets may not be left unattended for more than 2 hours and must be in a kennel/travel carrier. If you need assistance finding a dog-sitter please contact your hosts ahead of time.
4. Trash cans and bags are provided in the Loft (under the sink in the kitchen and bathroom). If the cans get full during your stay, please take the trash out and put in one of the trash cans in, or by, the driveway. No need to take out the trash at the end of your stay.
5. No hair dying or coloring is permitted in the Loft.
6. We do not have child safety features; children are welcome if you accept liability and are comfortable knowing we have no child proofing along with many stairs.
7. Minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied, in person AT ALL TIMES, by an adult over 21. You must be 21 to book a reservation at the Loft.
8. The antler hooks by the door will not hold heavy loads. Please only hang light jackets and clothing on them.
9. Please clean your boots/shoes as well as you can before entering the building and use the boot tray upstairs by the door for your boots and shoes.
10. Please do not block neighbor’s driveways, including the apartment’s next door. We will do what we can to help you with parking (including our driveway and street parking in front of our house). Please let us know if you’re traveling with a trailer so we can help you plan for parking.
11. If you would like to sit outside, you are welcome to use the camp chairs at the bottom of the stairs. If it is raining or too sunny, feel free to sit under the carport by the house. If we are parked there, just send us a message during daytime hours (9 a.m. to 9 p.m.) and we’ll move our car: we want you to enjoy your stay! You can also sit in the backyard but be aware that our dogs will occasionally need to be let out. If you are using the yard and/or grill, we will check with you before letting out the dogs. When sitting outside after 9 p.m. please try to keep the noise down so as not to disturb the residents and neighbors.
12. Do not go out on the roof. While it looks like a great place to hang out, it’s not safe for people and walking on the shingles are likely to cause damage.
13. Without exception, no smoking, vaping or marijuana usage inside the Loft. Please don’t think it can be covered up, it cannot. We have to extensively clean to remove the contaminant before other guests can arrive. Neutralizing this contaminant inside requires a $100 minimum service fee. Feel free to step outside in the back yard and quietly enjoy a tobacco smoke or vape; you'll just need to police your butts.
14. Before you leave, please wash any dishes that you used. Clean dishes can be left in the drainer to dry and we’ll put them away.
15. No need to strip the bed or pile up used towels and washcloths upon departure but during your stay, please hang wet towels and washcloths on the towel racks, shower curtain rod or side of the bathtub.
16. Please lock the door at the bottom of the steps whenever you leave the premises, including your departure.

photos/1/caption: Foggy Mountain Loft is an "L" shaped studio apartment, newly remodeled with added features to make your stay comfortable.
photos/2/caption: A small refrigerator/freezer (with bottled water waiting for you). The couch folds down to a small bed, if you're traveling with a third person.
photos/3/caption: If you forget your teddy, you can use ours; he's waiting in the room for you!
photos/4/caption: A comfortable full-size bed awaits you!

photos/7/caption: A microwave, coffee maker, water heater and toaster are available for your use.
