primaryHost/about: I'm a retired Army chaplain who likes to travel and is now offering our guest house behind our retirement home for you to enjoy.
sectionedDescription/access: Foggy Mountain Loft is on a residential street near town with free on-street parking. If you're towing a trailer, we'll try to save the spaces in front of the house for you with prior arrangement or you can use our driveway. You'll have a private entrance to the Loft at the end of the driveway with access through a digital keypad deadbolt lock.
sectionedDescription/description:
Great place near Hatfield & McCoy trailheads! The Foggy Mountain Loft has the feel of a mountain hideaway but in town, close to where you want to play & eat. There's a private entrance to this simple guest loft above the garage behind our home. You'll find a basic kitchenette, full bathroom, Roku TV and WiFi. At over 50 years old, the Loft shows its age with multiple layers of paint and years of cosmetic repairs, but it has been recently renovated to create a safe, clean & comfortable space.

The Foggy Mountain Loft is a single L-shaped room which has a double bed, futon couch, and a full bathroom with bathtub and shower. You can use our Adirondack chairs to spend time outside or stay in and watch your streaming apps on the Roku TV. There isn't a stove or oven in the Loft but there is a microwave, coffee maker, hot water kettle, toaster, air fryer and electric skillet for simple food preparation, and a grill in the garage you can use upon request.  There are also many great restaurants in Logan just a few minutes away.

Foggy Mountain Loft is on a residential street near town with free on-street parking. If you're towing a trailer, we'll try to save the spaces in front of the house for you with prior arrangement or you can use our driveway. You'll have a private entrance to the Loft at the end of the driveway with access through a digital keypad deadbolt lock.

We're available during your stay for assistance or to answer questions but you'll have as much privacy as you're looking for.

There are many places to eat in Logan and a lot of things to do:

Chief Logan State Park: 5.6 miles
Chief Logan Recreation Center: 8.2 miles
Dunks Body Shop (Gym): 12.5 miles
H & M Bearwallow Trail connector: 1 mile
H & M Bearwallow Trailhead: 4.1 miles
H & M Rockhouse Trailhead: 13.8 miles
H & M Buffalo Mountain Trailhead: 28 miles
H & M Devil Anse Trailhead: 34.6 miles

Gas station (which usually has the cheapest gas in Logan) is just about a mile away (just past the coffee house and bakery...)!

On street parking is easy to find near Foggy Mountain Loft. If you're raveling with a trailer you'll be able to find a spot within a couple blocks of the Loft. With prior arrangement, guests traveling with a trailer can have the parking spaces in front of  our house saved by us until their arrival or can park in the driveway (pulling truck into carport, there's room for a trailer with one ATV).

This is a 2nd floor loft with a narrow staircase, so you'll need to keep an eye on small children and keep in mind your own ability to climb stairs.

primaryHost/about: Husband, Dad, Surfer, Poet, Christian, Jack of all...
sectionedDescription/access: Entire home and property including creek- enjoy but wear shoes if wading in creek to be safe.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Olde Springhouse is our cozy cottage just one block off of Main street and a few more from the Virginia Creeper Trail-Head.  This gem is at the epicenter of shops, restaurants and nightlife!  Park upon arrival and enjoy all our quaint town offers within walking distance- The Barter Theatre, The Virginia Creeper Trail, The Tavern, Jack's 128 Pecan, Foresta, Summers Rooftop/Cellar, Rain, The Girl and The Raven, Wolf Hills Brewery, and much, much more- and it was literally built over a spring!

We are super Covid cleaning conscious. Additionally,  several of the restaurants within a couple blocks walk have outdoor dining/seating and the Creeper trailhead is 3 blocks away.  There is a mudroom with a bike rack for 5 bikes, and even a full sized mtn bike on-site for your convenience. You can seriously mitigate any Covid risks if you should choose to by enjoying great food, good drink, and exercise outdoors and steps away from the cottage.  Across the street from The Old Springhouse is a public park with lots of fun things for the kids and adults alike- including a covered picnic area and barbeque grill. The cottage also sits on Towne Creek with its famous resident Mallards!  Be careful though, as the creek runs thru town and is prone to have glass or debris in it. Wear shoes if wading!  There is a private driveway at the cottage but if you have more than one car, feel free to park across the street at the park.  Legend has it the park was home to the main town spring from which everyone got their drinking water.

Entire home and property including creek- enjoy but wear shoes if wading in creek to be safe.

You will have coded access to the house but we live just two blocks away so let us know if you need anything!

Literally you are within steps of the finest restaurants and theater that our area has to offer.  The renowned Highlands Festival takes place just at the top of the hill as well as Plum Alley Days and as mentioned, The Creeper trail-head and bike shops are a few blocks away. We are super Covid cleaning conscious. Additionally,  several of the restaurants within a couple blocks walk have outdoor dining/seating and the Creeper trailhead is 3 blocks away. You can seriously mitigate any Covid risks if you should choose to by enjoying great food, good drink, and exercize outdoors and steps away from the cottage. Hope to see you soon. Enjoy and stay safe!

Unless you are heading to the River, the Lake, or the AT, you can literally park your car and not move it until checkout- the best location around!

There is a firehouse across the street but the responders are VERY sympathetic to local residents and don't turn on their sirens until they are past the house and get on main street.  Also, Abingdon has a train track running the length of town- any house in town is “close”.  Several trains run during the course of the day, FYI.

sectionedDescription/interaction: You will have coded access to the house but we live just two blocks away so let us know if you need anything!
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Literally you are within steps of the finest restaurants and theater that our area has to offer.  The renowned Highlands Festival takes place just at the top of the hill as well as Plum Alley Days and as mentioned, The Creeper trail-head and bike shops are a few blocks away. We are super Covid cleaning conscious. Additionally,  several of the restaurants within a couple blocks walk have outdoor dining/seating and the Creeper trailhead is 3 blocks away. You can seriously mitigate any Covid risks if you should choose to by enjoying great food, good drink, and exercize outdoors and steps away from the cottage. Hope to see you soon. Enjoy and stay safe!
sectionedDescription/notes: There is a firehouse across the street but the responders are VERY sympathetic to local residents and don't turn on their sirens until they are past the house and get on main street.  Also, Abingdon has a train track running the length of town- any house in town is “close”.  Several trains run during the course of the day, FYI.
sectionedDescription/space: We are super Covid cleaning conscious. Additionally,  several of the restaurants within a couple blocks walk have outdoor dining/seating and the Creeper trailhead is 3 blocks away.  There is a mudroom with a bike rack for 5 bikes, and even a full sized mtn bike on-site for your convenience. You can seriously mitigate any Covid risks if you should choose to by enjoying great food, good drink, and exercise outdoors and steps away from the cottage.  Across the street from The Old Springhouse is a public park with lots of fun things for the kids and adults alike- including a covered picnic area and barbeque grill. The cottage also sits on Towne Creek with its famous resident Mallards!  Be careful though, as the creek runs thru town and is prone to have glass or debris in it. Wear shoes if wading!  There is a private driveway at the cottage but if you have more than one car, feel free to park across the street at the park.  Legend has it the park was home to the main town spring from which everyone got their drinking water.
sectionedDescription/summary: The Olde Springhouse is our cozy cottage just one block off of Main street and a few more from the Virginia Creeper Trail-Head.  This gem is at the epicenter of shops, restaurants and nightlife!  Park upon arrival and enjoy all our quaint town offers within walking distance- The Barter Theatre, The Virginia Creeper Trail, The Tavern, Jack's 128 Pecan, Foresta, Summers Rooftop/Cellar, Rain, The Girl and The Raven, Wolf Hills Brewery, and much, much more- and it was literally built over a spring!
sectionedDescription/transit: Unless you are heading to the River, the Lake, or the AT, you can literally park your car and not move it until checkout- the best location around!

sectionedDescription/description:
We are a family orientated facility, proud to offer quality large two-bedroom apartments featuring spacious private bathrooms, entertainment space, full kitchens. Bramwell, “Home of the Millionaires” is not to be missed!
We are ATV friendly and parking is available for trucks and trailers. The original Pocahontas Trailhead is just down the road. Pocahontas connects you to Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trail systems as well as outlaw trails.
This apartment has 1 king, 1 queen, & 1 full sleeper sofa.

name: Luxury Suite Downtown Abingdon VA
primaryHost/about: Adventuring through life. We use Airbnb for most of our trips, traveling with our kids or on getaways. Always choosing happiness and now enjoying hosting our own place to pass on the beauty of this community.
sectionedDescription/access:
Your Suite is located on the 2nd level of this 4 story building, along with a few additional suites available to rent.
Think Boutique Hotel vibes with a more custom and comfortable feel! We have designed these spaces to make you feel transported. Not only will you have a comfortable and private space to stay while visiting, you will enjoy the beauty of the design, history of the space, and the quaint and peaceful vibe of the area.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is a large private suite in the heart of downtown Abingdon Virginia. 

Located within 2 blocks of the Creeper Trail and right on Courthouse hill. There is no better location for your visit to Abingdon! 

Enjoy this Luxury Suite with unique amenities such as walk in shower, king size bed, original brick walls, and stained glass windows.

Wake up overlooking Main St. in this historic and beautiful town, while enjoying all the luxuries of modern amenities.

Built in 1894 and taking a total of 10 years to complete, The Greenway Trigg building is a wealth of charm and history.
Come spend time immersing yourself in the quaint history of Abingdon, VA.

What better way to do that than to stay in a 100+ year old building?! 
The Greenway Trigg building underwent a massive update in 2022 and is ready for bookings, new life, and new and modern retail spaces. 

This listing has had a complete make over! Previous reviews will specify things that are not applicable to the new space! Please be aware of that!

Enjoy the new retail spaces on the main level of the building, and the many pieces of art available for sale in the foyers of the grand old building.

Don't forget to peruse SONDER home + travel where you can find amenities used in your Suite available to purchase and take home with you.

Your Suite is located on the 2nd level of this 4 story building, along with a few additional suites available to rent.
Think Boutique Hotel vibes with a more custom and comfortable feel! We have designed these spaces to make you feel transported. Not only will you have a comfortable and private space to stay while visiting, you will enjoy the beauty of the design, history of the space, and the quaint and peaceful vibe of the area.

We are always available via message on the Airbnb app. Please do not call unless it is an emergency.

There is no better location to immerse yourself in the experience of Abingdon than right here in The Greenway Trigg building. 
Located within walking distance of The Barter Theatre, The Virginia Creeper Trail, The Tavern, White Birch Juice, The girl and the raven coffee shop, Wolf Hills Brewery and many many more attractions!

Bikes can be rented from the bike shop right around the corner. Walking is easy in all areas of downtown.

If you are bringing a dog- we ask that all pets are kept off the furniture. THIS IS A MUST. We are happy to have your pet stay, and are able to by requiring an additional pet fee. If we find that there is a pet and we were not notified previously, a $250 fee will be added to the booking total.

Take all personal items out of fridge and freezer.

additionalHouseRules:
You must also acknowledge: 

Security deposit: You may be charged up to $450 to cover damages.

No-smoking policy: This property is a 100-percent smoke-free home. Smoking is not allowed inside or outside the property. This policy is strictly enforced. Failure to comply will result in immediately being asked to leave with no refund and forfeiture of the damage deposit.

Pets: Dogs only, please. The pet fee is $20 per week (including any stay up to a week) for the first dog and $10 per week for a second dog. No more than two dogs. Dogs should be crated when left alone. Please clean up the yard after your pets and dispose of poop bags in the outdoor trashcan. Owners are responsible for their pets when outside in public; Glade Spring does have a leash law. Failure to acknowledge pets and to pay the related fees will result in guests immediately being asked to leave with no refund.

Porch sitting is highly recommended but quiet hours do begin at 10 pm.

Additional instructions will be shared to look over when you arrive.

name: LOFT🌿 Peaceful & charming 1.4 mi from I-81 Exit29
photos/3/caption: The bathroom is a generous size, with beautiful styling and accessories. A band of unique wallpaper is the crowning touch.
photos/4/caption: With its oversized sofa & chairs, the living room is the heart of this home. The space is stocked with a 50-inch smart TV, games, and books. Along with the kitchen, the great room provides a comfortable space for guests to gather.
photos/5/caption: Infrared fireplace stoves placed in each bedroom for a nice Winter ambience and to keep guests extra cozy warm during their stay at the loft (Can turn off and on/adjust temperature to suit own preferences.).
photos/6/caption: There is ample storage space in the master bedroom, including this chest of drawers and a closet.
photos/7/caption: The second bedroom is found behind a set of French doors that allow extra lighting into the room. A set of blinds can be lowered for privacy.
photos/9/caption: A view in the second bedroom of the privacy blind partially lowered.
photos/10/caption: A highlight of the bathroom is the brass faucet and other thoughtful design touches.
photos/12/caption: The wide covered porch has plentiful seating, including a cushioned sitting area and a cafe table set for coffee or snacks.
photos/14/caption: The master bedroom is an oasis of natural light and creative design details. The queen bed features a new memory-foam mattress.
photos/15/caption: A privacy wall adds an intimate and contemporary feel to the porch sitting area.
photos/16/caption: Iron handrails on both sides of the stairs provide extra safety.
photos/20/caption: Nighttime lighting sets the mood for an enjoyable evening outdoors.
photos/23/caption: A long fence extends from the front of the structure along the length of the yard. Landcape features complement the loft exterior.
photos/24/caption: A workdesk provides the perfect space for your on-the-road office needs. A wide selection of local brochures are provided to help acquaint you with the area and what it has to offer.
photos/25/caption: A set of cabana blinds add to the vacation vibe while also protecting the porch from rainwater. They're also useful for extra shading as the sun sets each evening.
primaryHost/about: Greetings! I am a business owner in my hometown of Glade Spring. I’m also the mother of three grown sons. When not enjoying the great outdoors, I indulge my passion for designing and building things. Hospitality is my love language, and I desire to make people feel comfortable and furnish spaces in the name of gathering. Fiddlehead Loft is the result of my combined interests. With this place, I am dedicated to providing a relaxing and pampered rental experience for everyone, whether you are a road-weary traveler or a visitor to our beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains region. I’d love to host you!
sectionedDescription/description:
Fiddlehead Loft is a newly renovated, thoughtful space stocked with guests in mind at every turn. Each hammered nail, design detail, and pillow purchase was executed with great hopes to serve you well and provide a beautiful, cozy environment for you to relax and enjoy your stay in. If we don’t have what you need, let us know!

Recent guest commentary: “We thoroughly enjoyed staying in your loft. So peaceful and quiet, with all the comforts of home… It’s a little diamond!” – June 7, 2021

When you first arrive at Fiddlehead Loft, you will see private parking for four cars. Enter the almost entirely enclosed & fenced yard, walk up the graveled path, and ascend the outside staircase to the second-floor loft. You’ll find yourself on a spacious covered porch with plenty of seating, including several chairs and a café table set that’s perfect for morning coffee or a snack (Brand new hammock on the way!)

Upon entering the loft, the first thing you’ll notice is the combination of warm tones and light walls with several windows letting in ample light. The stylish and modern décor throughout features greens and muted yellows, grays and browns, creams and blacks, all accented with natural fibers and live plants. This first room is a great room that encompasses a kitchen and dining area on one side and a living room on the other. A mini-split air conditioner is controlled from the living room but heats and cools the whole space.

In the living room to the right sits a comfy leather sofa and several oversized sectional chairs. A 50-inch smart TV and a bookcase filled with games, books, and magazines are ready for your relaxation. Or, if work is on the schedule, you can make use of the workspace separating the kitchen/dining area and living room. The loft is equipped with Wi-Fi. 

To the left is a beautiful modern kitchen and dining area. The table seats four (with room for two more at the workstation). The kitchen is filled with everything you’ll need to cook and serve, including a full-sized range and fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker. Plentiful cabinet and drawer space holds plate- and glassware, serving pieces, cutlery, utensils, and other small appliances, along with pots and pans. There’s also room for you to tuck away any food you purchase for your stay.

Moving through the great room toward the back of the loft space, you find on your right a lovely bathroom featuring a glass-enclosed full bath/shower combo. Brushed gold and black accents complement the white walls and gorgeous wallpaper, and a repurposed table creates the perfect vanity and sink space. The bathroom is stocked with plenty of towels and toilet paper for your stay.

Directly across from the bathroom sits an enclosed space with a stacked washer and dryer for your laundry needs.

Last, you’ll find two bedrooms in the back of the loft. The bright, naturally lit master bedroom sits to the right. A queen bed with a new memory-foam mattress is covered in soft, rich bedding, while two bedside tables sit ready to hold your current book, glasses, or nighttime toiletries. Double sconces mean you won’t have to fight with your bedmate over late-night reading. A bench at the foot of the bed is the perfect space for putting on your shoes or setting bags, while a full-sized dresser and closet await your clothes and accessories.

The cozy second bedroom sits in the back left corner of the loft. Glass French doors allow plenty of light into the space even when the doors are closed, but a pull-down shade provides privacy and darkness at night. This room contains a sturdy bunkbed set holding two double-sized mattresses with comfy bedding. There’s plenty of space to store your belongings and sconce lighting for both beds.

Filled with beautiful accents and thoughtful touches throughout, Fiddlehead Loft is the perfect home away from home for your long- or short-term travel needs. 

Notes:
•	A well-behaved and housetrained dog is welcome with a $20 nonrefundable fee per week ($10 per week for a second dog) to be collected in a separate payment. Please let us know when you book that you will be bringing a dog, so we can arrange payment. Dogs must be crated when left alone in the loft.
•	Fiddlehead Loft, although having the impression of being it's own structure, is located on the back of a building over a set of office suites (which are entered through the front of the building on a completely different side). They are almost always empty during the day and it remains very quiet. At night, the lower lever is most assuredly vacant, so you are alone in the building. 
•	Like many towns and cities in Virginia, Glade Spring is an historic railroad town, and a set of tracks does go through nearby. But the sounds are buffered and muted indoors, and guests report no issues. However, if you are particularly sensitive to outside sounds, you may wish to look elsewhere. 
•	Fiddlehead Loft is reached by a set of outdoor stairs to the second story. Those with mobility concerns may want to consider another property.

I am respectful of your privacy and will not be onsite during your stay, but I am happy to help in any way and live only a short distance if needed. Renters have full access to me via text or phone.

**Please note the loft is accessed from a side street to the back of the property.**

Glade Spring, Virginia
Located in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Southwest Virginia, Glade Spring is a quaint and peaceful little town boasting an historic square listed on the National Register of Historic Places. With easy access to the interstate and several restaurants and gas stations, it’s a convenient stop for travelers, especially those coming to the area for its many outdoor activities.

Fiddlehead Loft is located:

• 1.4 miles from I-81 on a quiet side street off Glade Spring’s historic town square. 
• 2 miles from the rails-to-trails gem The Salt Trail, the perfect place for a peaceful walk, bike, or horse ride in nature.
• 5 minutes from charming Emory, the home of beautiful Emory & Henry College. (Fiddlehead Loft is conveniently located for game-day lodging!)
• 10 mins from historic Abingdon with numerous excellent restaurants and shops, an award-winning winery, several coffeehouses, a hip brewery, and the world-renowned Barter Theatre.
• 15 mins from playful Damascus, known as Trail Town, USA. Experience the famous Creeper Trail bike ride off White Top Mountain or hop on a beautiful Virginia section of the Appalachian Trail.
• 30 minutes from the famous State Street of Bristol, VA-TN, with a variety of restaurants, shops, breweries, the 24-hour Blackbird Bakery, and the Birthplace of Country Music Museum. Don’t forget the requisite selfie of yourself standing with one foot in Virginia and one in Tennessee!
• Central to many outdoor adventure opportunities in our Blue Ridge Mountains, such as hiking in Mount Rogers National Recreation Area (look for the famous wild ponies), biking the Creeper Trail, or boating on gorgeous South Holston Lake.

** If you are looking for a last minute place to stay for the night, please feel free to send a request. I will do all I can to try to work it out.


** If you see there is only one available night left on a given weekend and you wish to stay only that one night, please contact me.

When you first arrive at Fiddlehead Loft, you will see private parking for four cars. Enter the almost entirely enclosed & fenced yard, walk up the graveled path, and ascend the outside staircase to the second-floor loft. You’ll find yourself on a spacious covered porch with plenty of seating, including several chairs and a café table set that’s perfect for morning coffee or a snack (Brand new hammock on the way!)

Upon entering the loft, the first thing you’ll notice is the combination of warm tones and light walls with several windows letting in ample light. The stylish and modern décor throughout features greens and muted yellows, grays and browns, creams and blacks, all accented with natural fibers and live plants. This first room is a great room that encompasses a kitchen and dining area on one side and a living room on the other. A mini-split air conditioner is controlled from the living room but heats and cools the whole space.

In the living room to the right sits a comfy leather sofa and several oversized sectional chairs. A 50-inch smart TV and a bookcase filled with games, books, and magazines are ready for your relaxation. Or, if work is on the schedule, you can make use of the workspace separating the kitchen/dining area and living room. The loft is equipped with Wi-Fi. 

To the left is a beautiful modern kitchen and dining area. The table seats four (with room for two more at the workstation). The kitchen is filled with everything you’ll need to cook and serve, including a full-sized range and fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker. Plentiful cabinet and drawer space holds plate- and glassware, serving pieces, cutlery, utensils, and other small appliances, along with pots and pans. There’s also room for you to tuck away any food you purchase for your stay.

Moving through the great room toward the back of the loft space, you find on your right a lovely bathroom featuring a glass-enclosed full bath/shower combo. Brushed gold and black accents complement the white walls and gorgeous wallpaper, and a repurposed table creates the perfect vanity and sink space. The bathroom is stocked with plenty of towels and toilet paper for your stay.

Directly across from the bathroom sits an enclosed space with a stacked washer and dryer for your laundry needs.

Last, you’ll find two bedrooms in the back of the loft. The bright, naturally lit master bedroom sits to the right. A queen bed with a new memory-foam mattress is covered in soft, rich bedding, while two bedside tables sit ready to hold your current book, glasses, or nighttime toiletries. Double sconces mean you won’t have to fight with your bedmate over late-night reading. A bench at the foot of the bed is the perfect space for putting on your shoes or setting bags, while a full-sized dresser and closet await your clothes and accessories.

The cozy second bedroom sits in the back left corner of the loft. Glass French doors allow plenty of light into the space even when the doors are closed, but a pull-down shade provides privacy and darkness at night. This room contains a sturdy bunkbed set holding two double-sized mattresses with comfy bedding. There’s plenty of space to store your belongings and sconce lighting for both beds.

Filled with beautiful accents and thoughtful touches throughout, Fiddlehead Loft is the perfect home away from home for your long- or short-term travel needs. 

Notes:
•	A well-behaved and housetrained dog is welcome with a $20 nonrefundable fee per week ($10 per week for a second dog) to be collected in a separate payment. Please let us know when you book that you will be bringing a dog, so we can arrange payment. Dogs must be crated when left alone in the loft.
•	Fiddlehead Loft, although having the impression of being it's own structure, is located on the back of a building over a set of office suites (which are entered through the front of the building on a completely different side). They are almost always empty during the day and it remains very quiet. At night, the lower lever is most assuredly vacant, so you are alone in the building. 
•	Like many towns and cities in Virginia, Glade Spring is an historic railroad town, and a set of tracks does go through nearby. But the sounds are buffered and muted indoors, and guests report no issues. However, if you are particularly sensitive to outside sounds, you may wish to look elsewhere. 
•	Fiddlehead Loft is reached by a set of outdoor stairs to the second story. Those with mobility concerns may want to consider another property.
sectionedDescription/summary:
Fiddlehead Loft is a newly renovated, thoughtful space stocked with guests in mind at every turn. Each hammered nail, design detail, and pillow purchase was executed with great hopes to serve you well and provide a beautiful, cozy environment for you to relax and enjoy your stay in. If we don’t have what you need, let us know!

Recent guest commentary: “We thoroughly enjoyed staying in your loft. So peaceful and quiet, with all the comforts of home… It’s a little diamond!” – June 7, 2021

additionalHouseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.

•	Guests are responsible for personal property.

•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully updated 2 full-bed 1-bath apartment features a complete kitchen with all the necessities, free Wi-Fi, and a smart TV in the living room and both of the bedrooms, with a DVD player included at each. Walking distance to shopping & restaurants. Includes two queen bed, towels & washcloths for 4 guests, and a charcoal grill on the covered balcony. Central heat & air. Pets allowed with additional per-pet fee. You will be just a short ride to all the Hatfield/McCoy trail systems.

***FULLY FURNISHED EXECUTIVE RENTAL***

ALL UTILITIES AND WI-FI INCLUDED!

2 Bedroom Apartment *Bluewell Area*

GPS Address: 219 Spurrier Rd., Bluefield, WV 24701

Everything you need in one place!
Are you looking for a nightly rental that’s just as comfortable as your own home?
If so, you have found the right place!

Spurrier Apt. 1
This rental has a full bed in both of the two bedrooms. Towels and washcloths are included for four guests.

It was just remodeled with brand new paint throughout, a new central heating and air HVAC unit, new bedding, new flooring, and leather dual-reclining sofa in the living room. This rental includes a complete kitchen with all of the necessities, from pots and pans down to silverware, and a full-size stove & refrigerator, and charcoal grill for your use on your private, covered, back patio! We have supplied everything down to the hangers to hang your clothes on inside of full-sized closets with dressers in both bedrooms. There is a smart TV in the living room and both of the bedrooms, with a DVD player included at each to watch your favorite Red Box movies on.

It is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants such as Dollar General, Gino’s Pizza, to a local favorite ‘Lynn’s Drive-In Restaurant’, a gas station, Advanced Auto, and even a laundromat. Razor and ATV riding is legal on all streets in this town. You can park your truck and trailer in the parking lot and ride straight to the trails. Great cell service, FREE WIFI, and it is only a short ride to all of the trail systems.

Side Note: You will have to go up steps to get to this two-bedroom apartment style nightly rental.

Contactless check-in and check-out is a must. You are emailed your door code and once inside you have an extra security door lock.
• 3:00PM check-in / 11:00AM check-out

Units are only available for out-of-town guests or corporate and business professionals looking for a temporary place to stay in the area.

Contactless check in and check out is a must. You are emailed your door code the day of check in and once inside you have an extra security door lock.

	3PM check-in & 11AM check-out. Early check-in and late check-out may
        be available for an additional fee.
	2-night minimum stay required which will include all of the luxuries you have in your own home.
	PETS WELCOMED! $100 non-refundable pet fee will be required though due to the extensive deep cleaning conducted after a pet has visited.

sectionedDescription/description:
Newly opened in downtown Pinevile, WV. Each room has different scene. Cool gel beds with all white comforters,
patagonon rosewood floors, granite counter tops, and top of the line accessories.  Drinks, snacks and desserts included in price of rooms. Lots of free parking. Easy access. Close to the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.  Quiet and friendly town. Nice view of the historical Wyoming County Courthouse and walking distance to Pinnacle Rock.

FREE WiFi, phones., parking. Easy Access. Handicap accessible
Free softdrinks, snacks and desserts. Feel right at home, if you get hungry, go to kitchen area and get a snack or pop some popcorn with softdrinks. Situated downtown Pineville, very quiet and friendly town. View of historical Wyoming County Courthouse and walking distance to Castle Rock. With 2 miles of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System. Plenty of parking for four wheelers and trailers.

On site employee til 9:00 p.m. and after hours emergency phone numbers provided. Maid service every day.

The Town of Pineville is very quiet and friendly town.  We have a
beautiful historical CourtHouse and a rock formation known as
Castle Rock. Pineville has access to the Hatfield McCoy Trail Head with 2 miles of town and four wheelers are allowed on the streets.  We have several restuarants to choose from. We are located downtown Pineville on Main Street.

Pineville has a park within walking distance, can hike Castle Rock and four wheelers and dirt bikes are allowed on the streets to get to the Hatfield McCoy Trails. No public transit is available. Host will be glad to take you where you need to go.

primaryHost/about: I'm a retired Christian. Your safety, privacy and comfort are most important while staying in my home. My life motto is to Love the Lord, and live according to his will.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is the home where I live. I travel a lot and decided to share my beautiful home with the Airbnb community!  The central location of my home makes it convenient for large groups to stay together while enjoying their visit to our area!

Although I will be away during your stay, I am always available to be reached by phone.  In addition, I have assembled a team of top notch individuals to be available for us should any need arise.

Walking distance to McDonald’s.  5 minutes drive or 25 min walk to restaurants on Main Street. 6 min drive to the Back of the Dragon

primaryHost/about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Rest and relaxation are what you can expect when you stay at this welcoming 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom vacation rental home in Wytheville. The house boasts a large deck where you can soak up the sun, a fully equipped kitchen to cook family meals, a hot tub, patio, firepit, and a cozy fireplace where you can sit and read or share stories. There’s no shortage of recreation in this area - spend all day exploring the New River Trail State Park, Stone Mountain State Park, or the Pilot Mountain State Park.

3/4 Acres | Across from Big Survey Forest | Private Hot Tub

Nature lovers, homebodies, and adventure seekers are welcome at this inviting abode featuring comfortable indoor and outdoor spaces, and a quiet location. 

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Twin/Full Bunk Bed

INDOOR LIVING: Smart TV, bathtub, gas fireplace, expansive windows, natural lighting
OUTDOOR LIVING: Expansive deck, patio, gas grill, outdoor dining area, fire pit, hammock, private yard 
KITCHEN: Fully equipped, stainless steel appliances, blender, coffee maker, cooking basics, spices
GENERAL: Free WiFi, linens/towels, air conditioning, books, central heating, washer/dryer, laundry detergent, adjustable base bed, smoke detectors, fire hydrant
FAQ: Access only by stairs (single-story home inside, exterior steps only)
PARKING: Driveway (4 vehicles)

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

OUTDOOR RECREATION: Crystal Springs Recreation area (3.4 miles), New River Trail State Park (19.4 miles), Hale Lake (21.3 miles), Comers Rock (23.7 miles), Dicky's Knob Trail (29.6 miles), Hungry Mother State Park (30.8 miles), Devils Nature Preserve (37.9 miles), Salt Trail (48.5 miles), Rowland Creek Falls (50.6 miles), Stone Mountain State Park (55.3 miles), Appalachian Trail at Mount Rogers (58.5 miles), Pilot Mountain State Park (69.7 miles)
THINGS TO DO: Fort Chiswell Animal Park (11.8 miles), The Blue Ridge Mountain Center (31.9 miles), Old Cranks Museum (36.6 miles), Jeff Matthews Museum (37.3 miles), High Country Lights (37.5 miles), Andy Griffith Museum (50.5 miles)
EAT + DRINK: 7 Dogs Brew Pub (2.1 miles), Graze on Main (2.3 miles), Chaus Corner Bakery (2.3 miles), Moon Dog Brick Oven (2.3 miles), Seven Sisters Brewery (2.4 miles), Log House 1776 Restaurant (2.5 miles), Peking Chinese Restaurant (3.3 miles), CJ’s Pizza (3.5 miles), Grayson Restaurant (3.9 miles), The Dutch Pantry (13.1 miles), Country Chicken (14.3 miles)
AIRPORT: Charlotte Douglas International Airport (144 miles)

sectionedDescription/access: Whole cabin
sectionedDescription/description:
This cozy little cabin is the closest lodge to Braveheart and Rockhouse Trailheads. Located on the Guyandotte river, park your rig and ride your ATV’s anywhere.
Located in a quiet, peaceful community, you will see kids riding their bicycles, duck and geese in the backyard and a puppy or two needing a belly rub! Great folks to welcome you to Hatfield Mcoy trails! Try us once, you’ll be back!

Whole cabin

We are available 24/7 and always close by. As little or as much interaction as you wish!

Less than 1 mile to Rockhouse Trailhead and Braveheart Trailhead. Town of Man, food, nightlife, grocery store, Hardee’s, Wendy’s, Fuel, Dollar General, Ice cream and more!

Park your trailer and ride your machines anywhere!!!

name: Cozy Hill Cabin - near Hatfield and McCoy’s Trails
sectionedDescription/access: Access to whole cabin.
sectionedDescription/description:
***NO PETS
Log cabin with gorgeous wood details w/ the “bear~essentials” 3 beds/1.5 baths. Upstairs is open loft area with king bed and full bathroom. Downstairs has 2 bedrooms, one with 2 twins and other with queen bed. Pull out couch in the living room with plenty of room for an air mattress. Outdoor grill and fire pit area. Ride your SxS/UTV to town & trailheads.

Cabin with loft bedroom and 2 other bedrooms with a pull out full size couch.

Access to whole cabin.

Town is a old coal mining town that allows riding SxS and UTV’s on public roads. Close to many trailheads.

Cabin is located in the ATV friendly town of Boissevain and 4 miles from Pocahontas (9 miles from the Town of Bluefield) with access to Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas Trail which connects to Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trails along with the Original Pocahontas Spearhead Trail.

additionalHouseRules:
PLEASE HONOR 10AM CHECK-OUT
The cleaning attendant will arrive based on scheduled check-out time.

No smoking inside the cabin.  Cigarette butts must be disposed of in the bucket provided on the front porch.

Please be attentive to your pets and dispose of any waste from them in the immediate, non-wooded area of the yard to avoid forfeit of the deposit.

Please do not allow pets on the furniture to avoid a forfeit of the deposit.

Please do not leave pet unattended while you are away from the cabin.

Please clean up excess dog hair or accident they may have in the house to avoid forfeit of the deposit.

Please DO NOT park on the grass to avoid forfeit of deposit.

No parties or events; Guests should leave premises in neat and undamaged condition.

Please RETURN ANY MOVED INDOOR OR OUTDOOR FURNITURE to its original location to avoid forfeit of deposit.
 
Please strip the beds before your departure.

No unregistered guests allowed, please adhere to property’s stated capacity.
 
Please respect the local noise ordinance of quiet time after 10p.m.

Please do not use grill up next to or on the front porch of the cabins.

Please wash and put away dishes before checkout.

Please remove all food from the refrigerator and cabinets before checkout.

Please dispose of all trash and place in the outdoor bins beside garage. 

Please report any damages and/or breakages in a reasonably timely manner.

name: Romantic Getaway on Little Creek
photos/1/caption: Studio style cottage with lots of attention to detail.
photos/2/caption: Beautiful view of cascades in a park-like setting at your doorstep.

rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Cottage on Little Creek is a romantic creekside retreat nestled on a quiet country road. This 53-acre property borders the Jefferson National Forest with private trails in a park like setting with small waterfalls throughout the property. An unparalleled place to relax from the daily grind but only a short, 15-minute drive to Wytheville, VA.

We are pet friendly with lots of room for you four-legged love ones to explore.
We charge a pet fee of $25 for the first pet per stay and $10 for each additional pet per stay. 
The pet fee is collected separately through AirBNB after the cabin is booked.

***Please read below***
Water:  We are in a beautiful, rural location with well water; it has a sulphur smell to it.  Although, completely safe to drink and bathe in it has a strong smell many people are not accustomed to this so I like to let guests know upfront.  I leave a gallon of water in the cabin along with the breakfast basket but I always suggest guests bring plenty of water to cook with.

Wi-Fi: As mentioned above, this is a rural location which is great to decompress and find peace and quiet but high speed internet isn’t available in this area. We provide satellite internet, so guests can use Wi-Fi texting and calling (dependent on your cell provider- cell phone service is very limited), check emails and surf the web but streaming Netflix and downloading music unfortunately don’t work.  We have the highest amount of gigabytes available with HughesNet Satellite but once the data caps are reached(which is easy to do if streaming is tried and continues to buffer) the internet eventually stops.  We ask you to please be conscientious with the internet usage so all our guests are able to use it throughout their stay with us.

This place is so special and we want our guests to love it as much as we do so if there is anything we can do throughout your stay we are happy to help.

We are in a rural location; cell phone service is limited but we do have Hughesnet Satellite wi-fi, it doesn't stream video but allows for surfing the web, answering emails, wi-fi texting and calling(depending on you cell phone carrier plan).

As like many people in rural America we are on a well water system so the water has Sulphur, which is completely safe to drink and bath in but does have a Sulphur smell and is an acquired taste.  We supply a gallon of water but suggest our guests bring extra water for drinking due to the taste.

name: Remote Mountain Cabin in the Woods
primaryHost/about:
My name is Pan. This Air B&B was formerly run by my husband James (Jim). Unfortunately, he passed away and we all miss him very much!
Now, I will continue to operate the Air B&B.  We will continue to welcome visitors to come and stay with us.

sectionedDescription/access: River access for fishing, kayaking, hiking and biking along the New River Trail and State Park
sectionedDescription/description:
Quiet private location in the woods with private path to the river

Like a time machine to the 1930's. 
All wood house and furniture. 
Old style plumbing. New electric. 
Gas stove for cooking 
Wood stove for heat (Electric and gas backup )
The cabin was built in 1920. Almost a century old. It was renovated in 1995 after Purchased by current owner. 
Please : No smoking inside the cabin. 
The driveway is very passable but some with low vehicle clearance have expressed I should give a heads up. If you’re not sure, you can walk down the driveway first. 
The river trail is over 50 miles long and no motorized traffic is allowed
 Very private. Located  on 75 acres of private property adjoining the New River Trail
Dogs allowed

River access for fishing, kayaking, hiking and biking along the New River Trail and State Park

No interaction with guests unless desired. Can give tour of the area as needed.

No neighbors to bother you. 
Every Thursday night there is a free bluegrass performance at the local recreation center in Fries. Local talent. 
7 to 9 pm

Bring your car, bike, horse or kayak. Or just walk here

Water source is from a spring and has delicious water. Please be conservative with water use although it fills automatically and has a 600 gallon reservoir. Babbling brook runs beside the yard all year. Clean clear water.
10 minute wooded Path to river alongside creek
Lots of flora and fauna so if you don't like bugs this may not be the place for you. Owner is a gardener who grows flowers and other unusual tree and bush specimens.
The cabin is 3 miles north of Fries and about 7 miles from Galax. 
570 Swinney Hollow Road , Fries, Va
The zip code is 24330 and not 24333 as shown in the listing. For some or another reason I can’t change it 
WiFi is good. It cellular service may not work unless you have US Cellular. 
Since some GPS signals may not be receptive here please print route before you leave home. 
I’m available if necessary for any further directions or inquiries

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #6 - The Doctor Johnston Sui
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #6 - The Doctor Johnston Suite

Dr. George Ben Johnston was the son of the original owner and builder of the home, John Johnston. Dr. Johnston was highly respected in the medical community for his surgical expertise and this room is named in his honor. The tucked away upstairs bedroom features two double beds and a private bathroom. Located across the hall from The Mary May Room, this suite is ideal for multiple guests. Full of light, bright and cheery, this room gives guests a pop of color with vintage red bed frames and a soft aqua rug. Also, the room has easy access to the rear staircase leading to the kitchen and most importantly the coffee maker.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

photos/0/caption: Proper queen-sized bed on the left and a queen-sized EZ Bed air mattress on the right. The air mattress can be added upon request.
sectionedDescription/access: Our guests may enjoy their suite, the patios, the kitchen and the upstairs full bathroom.
sectionedDescription/description:
A comfortable, large private suite in our home, that includes your own kitchenette, stocked with cold water and tea, private .5 bath in the suite and a private full bath on the second floor, HDTV and free WiFi. Located in a quiet neighborhood in Beckley, West Virginia. (50 min south of Charleston, WV, 4.5hrs from Washington DC, ). Snacks & coffee available.

 We look forward to seeing you!

There are two queen beds and couch in the room.

Our guests may enjoy their suite, the patios, the kitchen and the upstairs full bathroom.

I like to leave our guests to themselves to decompress from their journey and get some rest, but I will be around for any comments or to answer any questions you may have.

Someone is usually around the house, but if we are not home, then just text me.  -Sheila

photos/1/caption: Living Room

sectionedDescription/access: There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located in the heart of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System

HMT Rentals has direct trail access, we are  located in downtown Man, WV, less than one mile  from the Rockhouse Trailhead of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.

Check-In to our unit, drop your trailer, unload your machines and ride your ATV, UTV or Motorcycle directly to one of the local businesses in the Town of Man. Businesses include (Gas, Food, Bar and Grill, Sporting Goods!!)

There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.

Ride your machine through town to access the Hatfield McCoy Trail. Access Rockhouse Trail, Devil Anse Trail and Buffalo Mountain Trail. Also, ride your machine into town to eat at one of our many restaurants.

additionalHouseRules:
All reservations are considered confirmed at the time of booking. Please note that the  terms of this Rental Agreement are non-negotiable. This Rental Agreement MUST be agreed upon at time of booking. 
 1. RENTAL. The rental rate for the Rental Property is based on a party of four (4) persons. Guest acknowledges that additional persons are permitted provided the number of persons does not exceed the maximum occupancy for the Rental Property. Guest further understands that for each additional person, a fee of $10.00 shall be added to the nightly rental rate provided each additional guest is registered prior to check-in as set forth herein. 

2. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES. Guest may check-in at any time after 3:00 p.m. on Guest's Arrival Date, and the Guest shall check-out no later than 10:00 a.m. on the Guest's Departure Date. A minimum fee of $25.00 per hour may be charged to the renter’s card for checkout after 10:00 AM unless previous arrangements have been made through this office.

3. REFUNDS. Guest hereby agrees and acknowledges that Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest departs before the end of the Reservation or in the event Guest arrives late or does not arrive for the Reservation. Guest further hereby agrees and acknowledges that there will be no refund nor relocation in the event Guest is disappointed with the Rental Property. Furthermore, there shall be no refund or compensation for the occurrence of any and all events out of the control of DAISY'S CABINS, including but not limited to, weather conditions, power outages, water outages, mechanical failure of appliances and electronics, and/or central heat and air. Furthermore, Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest is required to vacate the Rental Property due to a violation of local, state or federal law or the policies of DAISY'S CABINS. Refunds will only be issued at the discretion of DAISY'S CABINS.

4. DAMAGES. Guest shall be solely responsible for any property damage, accident or injury to any person or loss sustained by any person, including loss of money, jewelry and other items of personal property, arising out of or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided by DAISY'S CABINS and/or the owner of the Rental Property. Guest shall inspect and be familiar with proper use and application of such items prior to using them. Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold DAISY'S CABINS and/or the owner of the Rental Property harmless from any and all claims including those of third parties, arising out of, or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided therein. 

5. AGENCY DISCLOSURE.  DAISY'S CABINS serves as the agent of the owner of the Rental Property. DAISY'S CABINS shall represent and act at all times in the best interests of the owner of the Rental Property. Furthermore, DAISY'S CABINS reserves the right for random inspections to insure that all policies and procedures are followed. All information provided by DAISY'S CABINS regarding the Rental Property has been provided by the owner of the Rental Property and is believed to be accurate, but cannot be guaranteed. Guest acknowledges that the owner of the Rental Property may remove the Rental Property from the rental program with DAISY'S CABINS. Guest further understands that availability of the Rental Property cannot be guaranteed, and DAISY'S CABINS may find it necessary to move Guest to a comparable rental property.

6. VISITORS. A Visitor of the Guest(s) may occupy the property on a temporary basis only. Visitors may not occupy the property beyond 10:00 pm or stay overnight without being registered with DAISY'S CABINS. Each rental property has a maximum occupancy and at NO time should said property be occupied by more than allowed number of guest stated. No house parties, weddings or other events are allowed. Should evidence of misuse or violation of occupancy be discovered at any time, the Guest(s) of record will be charged accordingly or immediately evicted without refund. 
 
7. USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY. Guest shall occupy and use the Rental Property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the Rental Property. The use of fireworks is strictly prohibited, and any violators of this provision shall be asked to vacate the Rental Property immediately.  Camp fires are permitted only in the designated fire pit and may only be used after 4 pm.  Camp fire must be attended at all times.

8. PETS.  Pets are NOT allowed in the rental property.  If evidence of a pet is found in the rental property, such as, but not limited to, feces/urine or fleas, a minimum of $50, together with the costs and expenses of additional cleaning services necessary to remove odors and/or stains shall be charged to the renter’s card. 

9. TELEVISIONS. A television equipped with Roku has been provided at DAISY'S CABINS.  There will be no option of ordering pay- per-view movies and/or events. In the event Guest orders a pay-per-view movie and/or event, Guest shall be assessed for the cost of the movie(s) and/or event(s), together with a service charge of $10.00. Satellite signal and reception and cable reception is not always reliable, especially during extreme weather, and cannot be guaranteed. 

10. INTERNET. Internet service is provided at all rental properties; however, the speed of the service is not guaranteed. The password for said service will be given to you at time of check-in or by calling the office. Please note that all internet services are not secured. Should guest be found illegally using, downloading, copying, and/or distributing copyrighted material over the network then guest shall be subject to any and all actions imposed by service provider for copyright infringement cost. 

11. FURNITURE. Please do not move any of the cabin furniture (including outdoor furniture) as this may scratch the floor causing damages. If the furniture or floors are damaged during your stay you will be held responsible and charged accordingly. 

12. HEATING AND AIR.  DAISY'S CABINS contains electric heat which is controlled by a thermostat in the winter months.  Central air and /or window unit air conditioners will be provided in the property during the summer months.

13. LOST AND FOUND. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall not be responsible for any personal belongings that are lost, stolen, or left behind by Guest or any member of Guest's party. Any personal items found in or around the Rental Property shall be held for thirty (30) days. After the thirty (30) days, any unclaimed items will be discarded or donated unless the owner of the item contacts DAISY'S CABINS and claims the item. The item will be returned to said individual at his/her expense. DAISY'S CABINS will not be responsible for any lost items or damage to the items during shipping.

14. REPAIRS. Guest hereby agrees that DAISY'S CABINS or its agents may enter the Rental Property for the purpose of making necessary repairs and/or maintenance in and around the Rental Property. Furthermore, DAISY'S CABINS does not guarantee against mechanical failures that may occur in the heating, air conditioning, television, satellite receivers, cable box, or any other appliances. In the event an appliance or system is inoperative, Guest shall contact DAISY'S CABINS immediately. DAISY'S CABINS shall make every effort to have the repairs done quickly and efficiently, or DAISY'S CABINS shall move Guest to a different rental property, if possible. Guest(s) who have an after-hours emergency at the number which will be provided to you. All non-emergency issues should be reported to DAISY'S CABINS, at the number which will be provided you, during regular business hours. For any medical related emergency, call 911.

15. AGE REQUIREMENT. Guest is at least eighteen (18) years of age and acknowledges that he/she may be asked to provide proof of age at the time the Reservation is made. Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the Rental Property during the Reservation. If Guest is not eighteen (18) years or older, DAISY'S CABINS reserves the right to terminate the Reservation without a refund. 

16. GARBAGE REMOVAL. All garbage must be bagged and removed from inside of the Rental Property. Bagged garbage may be placed in the outside garbage cans and will be picked up every other day of Guest's stay by an employee of DAISY'S CABINS.  Guest acknowledges that leaving garbage outside the designated container(s) may attract unwanted animals. 

17. SMOKING/NON-SMOKING. All properties are non-smoking. Smoking outside is allowed unless otherwise stated. Please be neat in disposing of cigarette butts, do not discard them around the property, driveway or yard. In the event smoking occurs inside the cabin, you shall be assessed a minimum charge of $250.00. 

18. CRITTERS & WILDLIFE. Please remember you are in the mountains. Each unit is professionally treated for pest control on a regular basis. Occasionally a few critters could make their way inside. In these rare instances, no refund will be given. In such a case, notify the office and we will make every effort to solve the problem in a timely manner. Please do your part by keeping windows and doors closed and all food and trash inside or in the appropriate outside receptacles.

19. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RISKS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges that there are certain risks of physical injury, property damage, and inherent potential dangers of the activities conducted within (or upon) the DAISY'S CABINS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges the risks and dangers associated with his/her use of the DAISY'S CABINS premises, facilities, and equipment, and that such use has inherent dangers of personal injury and property damage. The undersigned Guest further accepts sole responsibility for risks and dangers which include, without limitation, the potential for serious bodily injury, permanent disability, paralysis and loss of life, disfigurement, loss of or damage to equipment/property, exposure to extreme conditions, harmful physical conflicts with other guests, animal attack, snake bites, insect bites/stings, allergic reactions, lightning strikes, dangers arising from adverse weather conditions, falling, fires and burns, dangerous road or trail conditions, water hazards, land hazards, equipment failure, defective equipment, inadequate safety measures, criminal activity of other guests, poor lighting, and other undefined not readily foreseeable and presently unknown risks and dangers (“Risks”). Guest expressly assumes the Risks of any and all damage and injury of any kind or type which may result from any source whatsoever during his/her time on the premises of DAISY'S CABINS.

By booking this property, Guest is acknowledging that he/she has read, fully understands, and agrees to all the above.

photos/9/caption: Wifi availability and TV is equipped with Roku!

sectionedDescription/access: Guests will have the entire house to themselves.
sectionedDescription/description:
Hoot Owl Hideaway is situated in scenic Southwest Virginia. It is ideal for ATV enthusiasts looking for a nightly or weekly cabin rental.  You will be able to access Spearhead's Coal Canyon trail at the end of the driveway!  It's the perfect place to return after an adventure filled day of trail-riding.  A newly stocked catfish pond is also located on the property, so don’t forget your fishing poles!

Hoot Owl Hideaway offers 2 bedrooms and 1 bath and has all the essentials for your stay. WIFI is available and the TV is equipped with ROKU.  You will enjoy your own space with plenty of parking for your ATV trailers.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a stove, refrigerator, cook ware, utensils, and both coffee maker and Keurig.  Bed linens and dish towels are provided, but please bring your own bath towels.

Guests will have the entire house to themselves.

Hoot Owl Hideaway is 1/2 mile from the Grundy town limits, where various restaurants, a gas station, Walmart, and movie theatre are all located.  Additionally, it is a short drive to Elkhorn City, KY, where the Pine Mountain trails are accessible.

You will be able to leave Hoot Owl Hideaway's driveway and access Spearhead's Coal Canyon trail.  You also have the convenience of ATV access to the Grundy town center(about a 5 minute ride), where various restaurants, a gas station, and Wal-Mart are located.  Hoot Owl Hideaway is also a short drive from Breaks Interstate Park, Haysi, VA, and Elkhorn City, KY.   The Breaks Interstate Park offers various walking/bike trails, a water park, horseback riding, and zip lining.  Kayak tours are available in the local area through Levisa Adventures.  Additionally, river tubing is available on the Russell Fork River in the town of Elkhorn City, KY.  Time-Out Pizza/arcade offers tube rentals and a shuttle service for this activity.  Haysi and Elkhorn City offer 16 miles of whitewater rafting ranging from Class II to Class V rapids.
