 1. RENTAL. The rental rate for the Rental Property is based on a party of four (4) persons. Guest acknowledges that additional persons are permitted provided the number of persons does not exceed the maximum occupancy for the Rental Property. Guest further understands that for each additional person, a fee of $10.00 shall be added to the nightly rental rate provided each additional guest is registered prior to check-in as set forth herein. 

2. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES. Guest may check-in at any time after 3:00 p.m. on Guest's Arrival Date, and the Guest shall check-out no later than 10:00 a.m. on the Guest's Departure Date. A minimum fee of $25.00 per hour may be charged to the renter’s card for checkout after 10:00 AM unless previous arrangements have been made through this office.

3. REFUNDS. Guest hereby agrees and acknowledges that Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest departs before the end of the Reservation or in the event Guest arrives late or does not arrive for the Reservation. Guest further hereby agrees and acknowledges that there will be no refund nor relocation in the event Guest is disappointed with the Rental Property. Furthermore, there shall be no refund or compensation for the occurrence of any and all events out of the control of DAISY'S CABINS, including but not limited to, weather conditions, power outages, water outages, mechanical failure of appliances and electronics, and/or central heat and air. Furthermore, Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest is required to vacate the Rental Property due to a violation of local, state or federal law or the policies of DAISY'S CABINS. Refunds will only be issued at the discretion of DAISY'S CABINS.

4. DAMAGES. Guest shall be solely responsible for any property damage, accident or injury to any person or loss sustained by any person, including loss of money, jewelry and other items of personal property, arising out of or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided by DAISY'S CABINS and/or the owner of the Rental Property. Guest shall inspect and be familiar with proper use and application of such items prior to using them. Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold DAISY'S CABINS and/or the owner of the Rental Property harmless from any and all claims including those of third parties, arising out of, or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided therein. 

5. AGENCY DISCLOSURE.  DAISY'S CABINS serves as the agent of the owner of the Rental Property. DAISY'S CABINS shall represent and act at all times in the best interests of the owner of the Rental Property. Furthermore, DAISY'S CABINS reserves the right for random inspections to insure that all policies and procedures are followed. All information provided by DAISY'S CABINS regarding the Rental Property has been provided by the owner of the Rental Property and is believed to be accurate, but cannot be guaranteed. Guest acknowledges that the owner of the Rental Property may remove the Rental Property from the rental program with DAISY'S CABINS. Guest further understands that availability of the Rental Property cannot be guaranteed, and DAISY'S CABINS may find it necessary to move Guest to a comparable rental property.

6. VISITORS. A Visitor of the Guest(s) may occupy the property on a temporary basis only. Visitors may not occupy the property beyond 10:00 pm or stay overnight without being registered with DAISY'S CABINS. Each rental property has a maximum occupancy and at NO time should said property be occupied by more than allowed number of guest stated. No house parties, weddings or other events are allowed. Should evidence of misuse or violation of occupancy be discovered at any time, the Guest(s) of record will be charged accordingly or immediately evicted without refund. 
 
7. USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY. Guest shall occupy and use the Rental Property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the Rental Property. The use of fireworks is strictly prohibited, and any violators of this provision shall be asked to vacate the Rental Property immediately.  Camp fires are permitted only in the designated fire pit and may only be used after 4 pm.  Camp fire must be attended at all times.

8. PETS.  Pets are NOT allowed in the rental property.  If evidence of a pet is found in the rental property, such as, but not limited to, feces/urine or fleas, a minimum of $50, together with the costs and expenses of additional cleaning services necessary to remove odors and/or stains shall be charged to the renter’s card. 

9. TELEVISIONS. A television equipped with Roku has been provided at DAISY'S CABINS.  There will be no option of ordering pay- per-view movies and/or events. In the event Guest orders a pay-per-view movie and/or event, Guest shall be assessed for the cost of the movie(s) and/or event(s), together with a service charge of $10.00. Satellite signal and reception and cable reception is not always reliable, especially during extreme weather, and cannot be guaranteed. 

10. INTERNET. Internet service is provided at all rental properties; however, the speed of the service is not guaranteed. The password for said service will be given to you at time of check-in or by calling the office. Please note that all internet services are not secured. Should guest be found illegally using, downloading, copying, and/or distributing copyrighted material over the network then guest shall be subject to any and all actions imposed by service provider for copyright infringement cost. 

11. FURNITURE. Please do not move any of the cabin furniture (including outdoor furniture) as this may scratch the floor causing damages. If the furniture or floors are damaged during your stay you will be held responsible and charged accordingly. 

12. HEATING AND AIR.  DAISY'S CABINS contains electric heat which is controlled by a thermostat in the winter months.  Central air and /or window unit air conditioners will be provided in the property during the summer months.

13. LOST AND FOUND. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall not be responsible for any personal belongings that are lost, stolen, or left behind by Guest or any member of Guest's party. Any personal items found in or around the Rental Property shall be held for thirty (30) days. After the thirty (30) days, any unclaimed items will be discarded or donated unless the owner of the item contacts DAISY'S CABINS and claims the item. The item will be returned to said individual at his/her expense. DAISY'S CABINS will not be responsible for any lost items or damage to the items during shipping.

14. REPAIRS. Guest hereby agrees that DAISY'S CABINS or its agents may enter the Rental Property for the purpose of making necessary repairs and/or maintenance in and around the Rental Property. Furthermore, DAISY'S CABINS does not guarantee against mechanical failures that may occur in the heating, air conditioning, television, satellite receivers, cable box, or any other appliances. In the event an appliance or system is inoperative, Guest shall contact DAISY'S CABINS immediately. DAISY'S CABINS shall make every effort to have the repairs done quickly and efficiently, or DAISY'S CABINS shall move Guest to a different rental property, if possible. Guest(s) who have an after-hours emergency at the number which will be provided to you. All non-emergency issues should be reported to DAISY'S CABINS, at the number which will be provided you, during regular business hours. For any medical related emergency, call 911.

15. AGE REQUIREMENT. Guest is at least eighteen (18) years of age and acknowledges that he/she may be asked to provide proof of age at the time the Reservation is made. Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the Rental Property during the Reservation. If Guest is not eighteen (18) years or older, DAISY'S CABINS reserves the right to terminate the Reservation without a refund. 

16. GARBAGE REMOVAL. All garbage must be bagged and removed from inside of the Rental Property. Bagged garbage may be placed in the outside garbage cans and will be picked up every other day of Guest's stay by an employee of DAISY'S CABINS.  Guest acknowledges that leaving garbage outside the designated container(s) may attract unwanted animals. 

17. SMOKING/NON-SMOKING. All properties are non-smoking. Smoking outside is allowed unless otherwise stated. Please be neat in disposing of cigarette butts, do not discard them around the property, driveway or yard. In the event smoking occurs inside the cabin, you shall be assessed a minimum charge of $250.00. 

18. CRITTERS & WILDLIFE. Please remember you are in the mountains. Each unit is professionally treated for pest control on a regular basis. Occasionally a few critters could make their way inside. In these rare instances, no refund will be given. In such a case, notify the office and we will make every effort to solve the problem in a timely manner. Please do your part by keeping windows and doors closed and all food and trash inside or in the appropriate outside receptacles.

19. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RISKS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges that there are certain risks of physical injury, property damage, and inherent potential dangers of the activities conducted within (or upon) the DAISY'S CABINS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges the risks and dangers associated with his/her use of the DAISY'S CABINS premises, facilities, and equipment, and that such use has inherent dangers of personal injury and property damage. The undersigned Guest further accepts sole responsibility for risks and dangers which include, without limitation, the potential for serious bodily injury, permanent disability, paralysis and loss of life, disfigurement, loss of or damage to equipment/property, exposure to extreme conditions, harmful physical conflicts with other guests, animal attack, snake bites, insect bites/stings, allergic reactions, lightning strikes, dangers arising from adverse weather conditions, falling, fires and burns, dangerous road or trail conditions, water hazards, land hazards, equipment failure, defective equipment, inadequate safety measures, criminal activity of other guests, poor lighting, and other undefined not readily foreseeable and presently unknown risks and dangers (“Risks”). Guest expressly assumes the Risks of any and all damage and injury of any kind or type which may result from any source whatsoever during his/her time on the premises of DAISY'S CABINS.

By booking this property, Guest is acknowledging that he/she has read, fully understands, and agrees to all the above.
sectionedDescription/name: Hoot Owl Hideaway ~ Direct Spearhead trail access!
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Hoot Owl Hideaway is 1/2 mile from the Grundy town limits, where various restaurants, a gas station, Walmart, and movie theatre are all located.  Additionally, it is a short drive to Elkhorn City, KY, where the Pine Mountain trails are accessible.
sectionedDescription/notes: You will be able to leave Hoot Owl Hideaway's driveway and access Spearhead's Coal Canyon trail.  You also have the convenience of ATV access to the Grundy town center(about a 5 minute ride), where various restaurants, a gas station, and Wal-Mart are located.  Hoot Owl Hideaway is also a short drive from Breaks Interstate Park, Haysi, VA, and Elkhorn City, KY.   The Breaks Interstate Park offers various walking/bike trails, a water park, horseback riding, and zip lining.  Kayak tours are available in the local area through Levisa Adventures.  Additionally, river tubing is available on the Russell Fork River in the town of Elkhorn City, KY.  Time-Out Pizza/arcade offers tube rentals and a shuttle service for this activity.  Haysi and Elkhorn City offer 16 miles of whitewater rafting ranging from Class II to Class V rapids.
sectionedDescription/space: Hoot Owl Hideaway offers 2 bedrooms and 1 bath and has all the essentials for your stay. WIFI is available and the TV is equipped with ROKU.  You will enjoy your own space with plenty of parking for your ATV trailers.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a stove, refrigerator, cook ware, utensils, and both coffee maker and Keurig.  Bed linens and dish towels are provided, but please bring your own bath towels.
sectionedDescription/summary: Hoot Owl Hideaway is situated in scenic Southwest Virginia. It is ideal for ATV enthusiasts looking for a nightly or weekly cabin rental.  You will be able to access Spearhead's Coal Canyon trail at the end of the driveway!  It's the perfect place to return after an adventure filled day of trail-riding.  A newly stocked catfish pond is also located on the property, so don’t forget your fishing poles!

sectionedDescription/description:
Relax with the whole family on this peaceful working farm. Enjoy the farm animals and running stream in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains. Tour  the Blue Ridge Parkway or Creeper Trail.   Historic Wythe County, Wohlfahrt Theatre, Abingdon, Barter Theatre, Big Walker Lookout  Shot Tower, Draper Mercantile and so much more. Get unplugged, no distracting internet. Fish in the pond or make smores at the firepit.  Experience the farm with optional homegrown meals/tours. A little piece of heaven.

Beautiful renovated old cottage.

Separate little driveway runs right up to the cottage.
Enjoy sitting out on the upstairs balcony.

Located in Wythe Country, Southwest Virginia. Quiet, peaceful neighborhood, yet close enough to stores, restaurants. Lots of sightseeing and places to tour.
Fish right here in the pond on our farm
Bike, hike or swim.

Easy to explore and travel around by car.
Lots of local hiking and biking trails.
Also rivers for canoeing, tubing, swimming, fishing, etc.

name: Foxtail Orchards - "Hangar 22"
photos/12/caption: Shower with ceiling mounted shower head
photos/14/caption: Downstairs bedroom (king bed)
photos/19/caption: Kitchen , full refrigerator and mini stove.
primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, refrigerator and stove. 

There is also a second and a third rental near this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "The Iron Horse" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Please be aware there is a temporary drainage system installed at the front of the concrete pad, this may be a trip hazard, please watch your step.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi. 

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

Hangar 22 is built in memory of Sergeant Shawn Hess.  Sgt. Hess was killed in the line of duty while working as a Deputy Sheriff for Tazewell County Sheriffs Office..  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his friends and family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.


RECENTLY WE HAD TO INSTALL A NEW DRAINAGE SYSTEM AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE CABIN.UNTIL THE GROUND SETTLES,THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT LIP ON THE EDGE OF THE CONCRETE PAD ENTRANCE. THIS WILL REQUIRE YOU TO TAKE A SMALL STEP UP, CREATING A TRIPPING HAZARD. PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS STEP UP. IT WILL BE MARKED WITH FLUORESCENT PAINT.PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS AND BE CAREFUL.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Please do not block the road, If you need additional parking beyond your provided space, park at the bottom of the hill out of the path of the roadway!  This road is also a one-way in and one-way out, as you enter stay to the right, the road loops  around and will bring you back out.


Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.
sectionedDescription/interaction: We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.
sectionedDescription/notes:
Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi. 

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

Hangar 22 is built in memory of Sergeant Shawn Hess.  Sgt. Hess was killed in the line of duty while working as a Deputy Sheriff for Tazewell County Sheriffs Office..  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his friends and family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.


RECENTLY WE HAD TO INSTALL A NEW DRAINAGE SYSTEM AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE CABIN.UNTIL THE GROUND SETTLES,THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT LIP ON THE EDGE OF THE CONCRETE PAD ENTRANCE. THIS WILL REQUIRE YOU TO TAKE A SMALL STEP UP, CREATING A TRIPPING HAZARD. PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS STEP UP. IT WILL BE MARKED WITH FLUORESCENT PAINT.PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS AND BE CAREFUL.
sectionedDescription/space:
This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, refrigerator and stove. 

There is also a second and a third rental near this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "The Iron Horse" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Please be aware there is a temporary drainage system installed at the front of the concrete pad, this may be a trip hazard, please watch your step.
sectionedDescription/summary:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

additionalHouseRules:
No swimming or ice skating in ponds !!! Children must be supervised at all times !! Do not feed wildlife !
Do not leave trash outside.  No smoking inside. Fire pit must be out complete before you leave or go to bed. Shoes off when entering the home. Lock door if going out or leaving premises. By signing house rules agreement we are not liable for any accident or injury on our property.

name: Whispering Pines Private Cabin 5 mins off I-77
primaryHost/about: We are a nature loving and hard working family. We came to Bland several years ago for the beauty and private way of living. Walkers Valley is one of the most beautiful places you will ever see. Serenity, peacefulness, and the beauty of the mountains, are all the reasons we moved here.  We invite you, our guests, to come and see for yourself. We promise, if you love the outdoors as much as we do, you will be able to appreciate the beauty of Bland, Va.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guest have full access to the cabin and pond. Children MUST be supervised at all times.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enchanted cozy cabin " Whispering Pines " located 5 minutes off I-77 in Bland, Va.  Our cabin is  located on 8 acres of property and full  of various types of wildlife.  Sometimes, you will see bear, deer, wild turkey, and squirrels. We also live on the property, but the cabin is private and  tucked away within the beautiful whispering pines.

. The interior has recently been updated with appliances and decor including farmhouse style. The exterior of the cabin has also been recently renovated. There is a  peaceful fire pit for your family to enjoy.  You will need an All Wheel Drive (AWD) or Four -Wheel Drive vehicle (4x4) in order to drive all the way to the cabin because the incline is a little steep for a 2 wheel drive. There  is a parking lot at the top of this incline for all the Non-AWD and Non-4x4 vehicles.  Please note, you will only have to walk approximately 75 yards down the hill to the cabin. The other Parking lot is at the bottom. Upon request, a pack & play can be provided for your baby or toddler. The cabin is NOT wheelchair accessible and has NO WIFI! Cell service is limited to Verizon, however AT&T will pick up 1 bar and LTE. The cabin has No cable TV; however, there is a 42 inch TV available with multi-selection DVDs for adults and children.  We have also included a selection of books for adults and children. Our property has 2 ponds,  a mid-sized refrigerator, sink, dishes, pots/pans,  silverware, cooking utensils, and a Keurig coffee pot. Enjoy your evening sitting by the firepit or gazebo by the pond. Although, our water source is from freshwater springs, we do advise not to drink, to be on the safe side; however you can boil the water for drinking and cooking. We will provide each guest with one bottle of drinking water.  Whispering Pines cabin is sparkling clean and  very quiet with a peaceful rustic setting.

Guest have full access to the cabin and pond. Children MUST be supervised at all times.

Available by cell phone.

This cabin is nestled in the Blue Ridge mountains surrounded by the Washington Jefferson National Forest. There are many Appalachian trail heads  in Bland county and  many things to do nearby. The closest Appalachian trailhead from the cabin is only 2.1 miles. Fort Chiswell Animal Park(16 miles), Wytheville (11 miles), Dismal Falls Retreat (14 miles), Wolf Creek Indian village and Museum (5.3 miles), Big Walker Lookout (10.6 miles), Dollar General (2.1 miles), Grants supermarket (1.8 miles), and some of the best sandwiches, cheeses, furniture, and Amish hospitality around,  Walkers Valley Market(16 miles).

24 hours before your arrival I will provide you a Key Code for the Lock Box.

No swimming or ice skating in ponds !!! Children must be supervised at all times !! Do not feed wildlife !
Do not leave trash outside.  No smoking inside. Fire pit must be out complete before you leave or go to bed. Shoes off when entering the home. Lock door if going out or leaving premises. By signing house rules agreement we are not liable for any accident or injury on our property.

name: Lucy's Mountain View
primaryHost/about: My husband and I are travel enthusiasts with a passion for exploring new places and trying new foods. We value the learning and personal growth that come with travel, and love sharing our experiences with others. That's why my husband and I decided to create Escape Vacation Rentals, where we can share our personal spaces with others from all over. We believe that travel has the power to broaden our horizons and connect us with people and places we might never have encountered otherwise. We hope you enjoy our little spaces as much as we do!!!

sectionedDescription/description:
Sleeps up to 15 with additional space for air mattresses on 5 acres with two freshwater streams!  As of June 2020, we now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET. 
The property is centrally located near several recreational attractions.  Winterplace Ski Resort (46 miles), The Hatfield McCoy ATV trail system (31 miles), The Appalachian Trail 18 miles), Burkes Garden, VA (12 miles), Hungry Mother State Park(42miles), Back of the Dragon (23miles), Tazewell Aqua Park (15 miles) and The New River.

This 5 Bedroom with 2 full and 2 half bathroom home is located on 5 acres in beautiful southwestern Virginia.  
Easily found and accessible from Interstate 77 (13 miles) and Interstate 81 (40 miles).
First floor (main living floor) includes the kitchen, dining, den, laundry, ½ bath and master bed/bathrooms.
Second floor includes the living room, 3 bedrooms, 1 ½ bathrooms.
Third floor includes a finished room with 2 sets of bunk beds.
Other amenities include basic cable television, WIFI internet, washer/dryer and dish washer.
Outside you will find a large wrap around porch and large rear deck with great mountainous views.  A spacious yard with fire pit is bordered on two sides by separate freshwater streams that hold trout at certain times of the year.
We now have HIGH SPEED INTERNET

2 creeks 
Fire pit 
Walking trails

Available for all your questions phone, text or email.

The property is centrally located near several recreational attractions. Winterplace Ski Resort (46 miles), The Hatfield McCoy ATV trail system (31 miles), The Appalachian Trail 18 miles), Burkes Garden, VA (12 miles), Hungry Mother State Park(42miles), Back of the Dragon (23miles), Tazewell Aqua Park (15 miles) and The New River.

A wide driveway with egress from a paved county road (Rt. 61) provides entrance to the property and will accommodate multiple large pickup trucks pulling trailers (ATV’s, Horses, etc.) and will also allow excessive room for turn around.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Please do not wear shoes in the house, No pets allowed due to allergies. 

No shooting guns on property

sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy relaxing on our patio, or get to know our alpacas.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy a relaxing stay on our alpaca farm, Long Neck Lair, overlooking the picturesque Appalachian Trail.  We offer a comfortable private room in our home for business travel or vacation/getaway travel.  We share opportunities for our guests to interact with and learn about our alpacas. Convenient location off of I 81 at exit 54 on Route 11 N between Marion, Virginia and Wytheville, Virginia.

First floor room in our home has a private entrance and private bathroom. In room amenities include comfortable queen sofa bed, television, mini refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer.

Enjoy relaxing on our patio, or get to know our alpacas.

We are excited to share our farm with our guests! We are available to answer questions and share southern hospitality.

Long Neck Lair is in a rural setting, yet conveniently located to the towns of Marion, VA and Wytheville, VA. Marion is a ten minute drive away and is home to Hungry Mother State Park and Lincoln Theatre. Wytheville is a fifteen minute drive away and offers museums, entertainment, and history. Both towns have restaurants and shopping.  There are two restaurants within walking distance of our farm.

Our farm, Long Neck Lair, is located on Route 11 North approximately 1/2 mile off of I 81 at exit 54. Access to the Appalachian Trail is 3/10 of a mile from our farm.Please check the Mountain Lynx Transit website for information on limited transportation in our area.

Please contact us for same day availability.
Our farm is home to alpacas, chickens, dogs, and cats. Please take note, if you have allergies.
(Room rate includes 10.3% state and local taxes.)
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
- Children are welcome, but please be aware that this is a farm and children should be watched at all times.
- Well behaved, friendly pets are welcome. No aggressive breeds, please. Please let us know they will be joining you. Please do not leave them unattended in the room, and they must be leashed when outside.

name: Burkes Garden Cottage
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Experience the beauty and culture of Southwest Virginia and enjoy the serenity of mountain life in beautiful Burkes Garden. This picturesque farming community sits in the highest valley in Virginia designated a Rural Historic District. Nestled beside the Parsonage Guest House, our cottage called "the Little House" is a vintage 50's cottage but with all the modern conveniences. With one queen and one  double bed it is perfect for 3 to 4 people or a couple's retreat.

The entire house is rented to one party at a time.

name: The Dragon's Den - Upstairs Private Room 3
photos/14/caption: Rent me on Riders Share. No motorcycle license required!
primaryHost/about: I am a motor head for as long as I can remember and enjoy spending time in Tazewell so much I decided to build my own AirBnB and share my passion with others.
sectionedDescription/access:
Enjoy The Back of the Dragon in a whole new way with the Vanderhall Venice GT!  An open air roadster experience like no other available from The Dragon's Den! Available on Riders Share.

Guests will have access to all shared spaces in the house including kitchen, dining and living rooms along with outdoor spaces.
sectionedDescription/description:
Minutes from downtown shopping and dining and easy access to the infamous Back of the Dragon. One hour to Winterplace Ski Resort, WV. Also one hour to the famous Hatfield McCoy trails.. High speed wireless internet throughout the entire property. 40" HD Smart TV in every room.

This is a second floor bedroom with access to the kitchen, bathroom and patio. Room has a 40" HD smart TV and WiFi enabling you to use your favorite streaming app. Enjoy the entire home including kitchen, 2 bathrooms and front and back porches.

Enjoy The Back of the Dragon in a whole new way with the Vanderhall Venice GT!  An open air roadster experience like no other available from The Dragon's Den! Available on Riders Share.

Guests will have access to all shared spaces in the house including kitchen, dining and living rooms along with outdoor spaces.

Either myself or someone that works with me will be available 24/7 during your stay making sure it is comfortable and relaxing.

Come explore historic downtown Tazewell, VA and everything it has to offer. Walking distance to breweries and restaurants, Tazewell is a beautiful place to relax and call home for the weekend.

Not much public transportation so a car/motorcycle is required.

The house is on a septic system.  Only the provided toilet paper can be flushed.  All other items need to be disposed of in provided bins.  There will be an additional fee of $25 for use of the airbed or pull out couch.

cameras monitor the driveway and front porch.

name: Stay @Tin Roof! Clean 3Bed 2Bath near trailheads
photos/15/caption: Master King
photos/16/caption: Master King
photos/19/caption: Master Bath
primaryHost/about: I am a realtor from coastal NC. I love traveling and do so often!
sectionedDescription/access: Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill
sectionedDescription/description:
The whole group will enjoy easy access to everything from this centrally located place. The Tin Roof is located near the Hatfield McCoy trails where you have multiple trailheads to choose from. No need to load your trailer, ride your ATV directly from this location. Tin Roof is 37 miles from Winterplace for the ski bunnies!  Multiple lakes for a day in the kayak , hiking trails to get in your steps , and several restaurants to enjoy;  all located close by! Two living rooms and plenty of space!

Three trucks and Three trailers ( depending on length) will fit in driveway. All three bedrooms have large beds and room for all your gear! Two living rooms  2 Tv’s and plenty of eating space at the kitchen island or dining table. A full laundry room, front  deck with outdoor eating area, and a fire pit in the backyard for evening relaxing!  For your convenience there is a permanent charcoal grill. The Keurig and crockpot are a few of the extra additions to the kitchen that will make your stay easy!  Basic cable in the living room and smart TV in the den . Brand new mattresses , furniture installed September 2021.  Towels , Hand Towels , washcloths, and all bed linens included.  Fully stocked kitchen with dishes , cups , and cooking utensils.

Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill

Fee free to message with any questions or suggestions!

Tin Roof is located in an ATV friendly town where you can drive your ATV to restaurants , gas stations and trailheads.  Located minutes from Various trail heads as well as restaurants. We are also near Bluefield University and a short trip to the VA line . As well as a short drive to a nearby airport.

While public transportation may be sparse, vehicles, ATV’s and hiking are no issues to get around.

This property is adjacent to  a main road HWY 52, and less than a mile from Lorton Lick rd, we also live off a small quiet road. We ask that you respect our neighbors and refrain from parties or disruptive behavior. You can access HWY 52 from our front yard with an atv , please stay to the left of the rock/boulders which mark our property line. Toilet paper , paper towels , shampoo and soap are provided. Coffee , sugar and honey for your first morning will also be available . Laundry detergent, dish detergent, and sponges. Ready for your arrival !

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #7 - The Nelle May Room
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #7 - The Nelle May Room (Shared Bathroom)

A room just as stunning as Andrew Jackson May’s second wife (who was 51 years his junior), the Nelle May room is a picturesque part of the mansion and is quickly becoming a guest favorite for it’s good vibes, early morning sunshine, happy wall coloring and vintage white painted bed. This expansive, bright, and cheerful bedroom features a queen-sized bed, fireplace and also has a cozy sitting area. It is a perfect room for folks looking for a recharging environment.

name: Bramwell Hill Manor
sectionedDescription/description:
Bramwell Hill Manor is ATV friendly house over looking the town of Bramwell WV and is  located 1/4 mile from the Hatfield McCoy's Pocahontas ATV Trailhead and 4 miles from the Original Pocahontas Trail on Virginia's Spearhead trail system. The house is furnished with towels and liens. The kitchen has everything you need for cooking or use the BBQ grill on the covered patio. The house has WIFI and cable TV. 

Over 4 guests is an additional $25.00 per guest per night.

I will available in case you need something or have questions..

The house is located 1/4 mile from the Pocahontas Trail head.

You can drive your ATV to the trailheads on the highway from the house.

additionalHouseRules: I ask guests to avoid any scented (fragranced)  body lotions,  colognes, shampoos etc  in the house. Other guests may also be staying here who have allergies and sensitivities. And for housekeeping, it can take multiple washings to remove some scents.  I do offer fragrance-free shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, or  laundry soap as amenities that you are welcome to use!   GOATS: Please check with me before feeding them or opening gates. CHECKOUT: If your stay is on a Saturday, I request a 9 a.m. Sunday checkout, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed.Thank you!

primaryHost/about:
Part of what made us want to be an Airbnb hosts is the wonderful hospitality we've known in our own travels.  As native Appalachians, my husband and I have a deep love for this region and its people and the tradition of hospitality.  We are both artists of sorts--I'm a freelance writer/reporter and he is a rock 'n roll keyboard player and works in the local school system. And we manage a herd of dairy goats, mostly LaMancha breed. All with names and personalities. Our place is about 15-20  minutes off off I-77. We're close to the notable "Back of the Dragon" motorcycle routes. And very close to some beautiful backroad bicycle routes. The scenery is beautiful all seasons of the year but especially the fall. We hope you'll visit!

 As for the goats, they are "the greatest entertainers and the greatest time wasters" as my dad used to say. He was a vet and built the house as a home and office. So it has a sort of historic/museum feel in certain sections. 

We don't guarantee food as part of our Airbnb listing,  but I love to cook and if I'm cooking, you're welcome to join us if you don't have other plans. 

Last but not least, we  love to know a little about our guests beforehand so PLEASE make sure you fill out the "Describe Yourself" questions under the Airbnb profile section to speed along the booking process.

Safe travels!
sectionedDescription/access: Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)
sectionedDescription/description:
This is the best sleeping room in the house. Hot water radiator heat keeps the room warm in the winter and concrete floors keep it comfortably cool in the summer. There's access to a full bath with tub and shower but you must walk up a flight of stairs. I also try to keep the house as free from allergens/fragrances as possible for guests who have sensitivities (noted in House Rules below).

The wi-fi is very poor in the bedroom but great in the parlor room just down the hall.

Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)

I'm in and out of the spaces with shared access but your bed and bath are always private. I like to socialize and interact with guests but I'm also happy to leave you to your own privacy.

There's a great little biking road about 1/4 mile from my home that lots of bikers love to ride. About 5 miles away is a great mountain bike trail at the Blfd WV city park. For more serious bikers, there's the Burkes Garden trail. 
For hikers, Lincolnshire Park, about 13 miles away in Tazewell, has features so beautiful you will think you're in the The Hobbit's  "Shire." 
For other things to do and places to eat, see my Guidebook section of Guest Resources.

The Town of Bluefield, Va. operates Graham Transit. Graham Transit runs three deviated fixed routes throughout the area each day. I am a 5 minute walk from the closest bus route stop.  Bus route schedules are listed on the Town of Bluefield, Va. official website.

Please have the the Airbnb "describe yourself" profile questions filled out (type traveler you are, etc) before you request to book. Also, the local (county) occupancy tax is included in the room price.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: I ask guests to avoid any scented (fragranced)  body lotions,  colognes, shampoos etc  in the house. Other guests may also be staying here who have allergies and sensitivities. And for housekeeping, it can take multiple washings to remove some scents.  I do offer fragrance-free shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, or  laundry soap as amenities that you are welcome to use!   GOATS: Please check with me before feeding them or opening gates. CHECKOUT: If your stay is on a Saturday, I request a 9 a.m. Sunday checkout, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed.Thank you!

additionalHouseRules:
Please do not block the road, If you need additional parking beyond your provided space, park at the bottom of the hill out of the path of the roadway!  This road is also a one-way in and one-way out, as you enter stay to the right, the road loops  around and will bring you back out.


Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

name: Foxtail Orchards - "The Fox Den"
photos/13/caption: Relax by the fire!
photos/15/caption: Beautiful Mountains!!
photos/16/caption: A sunset you will never forget! Romantic Getaway!
photos/17/caption: Great Views!!
primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, mini fridge, and hot plate.

There is also a second and a third rental just above this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "Hangar 22" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Enjoy the sounds and setting of living in the country.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi.

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

The Fox Den is named and themed (decor) after Virginia State Trooper Andrew D. Fox.  Andrew was a native to Tazewell County and a graduate from Tazewell High School.  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.

name: Warrior Trail: Love Shack Caretta 768: ATV lodging
photos/1/caption: Cozy Living Room with Queen Sleeper Sofa
photos/7/caption: nice dine-in kitchen for family meals
photos/14/caption: short drive to Warrior Trailhead; ATVs can be ridden on roads.
primaryHost/about:
Christian Couple who loves to enjoy time together in the outdoors! We enjoy meeting new people, and spending time with family and friends.
We are parents, grandparents.. youth leaders, business owners... dog-lovers!
When we get a free moment we take off to WV to ride Four-wheelers with our friends and family. We love to discover new trails, sights, and attractions. 
We are new at hosting, but excited to share our home with others who love to get "out and about"!
sectionedDescription/access: Full house access, basement with washer and dryer. back yard with grill, creek, walking bridge to explore
sectionedDescription/description:
2 Bedroom, 1 bath creekside house located within minutes of the newest Hatfield McCoy trailhead: the Warrior Trail. Surrounded by beautiful mountains, and Outlaw trails. Cozy living room and spacious dine-in kitchen. Plenty of parking for trucks, trailers, and ATVs makes this place ideal for outdoor adventurists.

2 Bedroom, 1 bath creekside house located within minutes of the newest Hatfield McCoy trailhead: the Warrior Trail. Surrounded by beautiful mountains, and Outlaw trails. Cozy living room and spacious dine-in kitchen. Plenty of parking for trucks, trailers, and ATVs makes this place ideal for outdoor adventurists.

Full house access, basement with washer and dryer. back yard with grill, creek, walking bridge to explore

We are available by phone or text almost anytime. We are often in the area, but live out of town.
We are glad to answer questions about local trails and attractions as well as easy directions to the house.

Our house is on a main road between War, WV, and Welch, WV. There are restaurants, gas stations, a beautiful lake area, and a movie theater all within 10-20 minutes. You can ride your ATV pretty much anywhere you want to go.

You can go almost anywhere by ATV.

Watch your step on exiting back door

- Special consideration can be given for pets.  Message me individually 
- Accompany children at all times.
- You can smoke outside but please avoid throwing butt's on ground.
- be careful in dry seasons of fires outside.   Put any fire outside completely out with water.   Winds are strong at the top of mountain and can restart your fires that aren’t fully out out and blow embers into dry leaves.   
-  no hunting unless otherwise permitted by owner and properly licensed.
-  no chopping down of live trees or chopping into damaging move trees.   
- lastly, Don't be an idiot.

name: Adventurer's Paradise!
photos/0/caption: Beautiful summer view from deck.   One trail going around the property.  2 going down the middle.  one long trail going to my brothers property.
photos/1/caption: Front of cabin
photos/3/caption: Back of the cabin and driveway
photos/10/caption: Living room.  Please see new couch  and set up pictures.  we still have these but the couch is upstairs and chair is to the side and the new couch is in it's place for more seating.
photos/13/caption: Master Bathroom
photos/14/caption: Guest Bedroom 1 twin bunk beds
photos/15/caption: Guest Bedroom 2 Queen bed
photos/16/caption: Guest Bathroom
photos/19/caption: road up to the cabin
photos/21/caption: Winterplace.com.  30 minutes from bottom of mountain.
primaryHost/about:
I live for adventure and the great outdoors.  I want to share it with people and promote fun and adventure for others.  I will work with whoever to try and maximize each individual experience.  
I myself can't live without music. Hence you'll find a Bluetooth radio and speakers in the kitchen.   I attend many rock concerts each year, but I love all forms of music.  I love to cook, so you'll see my kitchen is set up for a cook.  
My style of travel is one were you would like to forget you have a cell phone!
My life motto since I was in high school is "Body, Mind, and soul"  Stay healthy, be smart, and be a good person!
sectionedDescription/access: You have access to the whole cabin and the trails on the property as well as the trail that goes to my brothers property that can be hiked or used by ATV's.  You also have access to the private community waterfall.
sectionedDescription/description:
18 acre Mountaintop cabin located in Bluefield, VA.  Beautiful views of the Jefferson National Forest.   Located in a gated community called Cove Creek which consists of many  large acre properties and very little development.  Several trails located directly on the property for atv riding and hiking.  The community is atv friendly and also boasts a beautiful creek containing brook trout and picturesque waterfall.  Winterplace , Hatfield Mccoy Trails, and Appalachian trail all only minutes away.

There are many things that make this cabin unique.  First, it's  a  1,200 sq foot 3 bedroom fully equipped cozy cabin property on 18 acres and has breathtaking mountaintop views and private access to our own trails for hiking and ATV'ing.  It's also centrally located to several well known mountain adventure places for White water rafting, Skiiing, ATV'ing, Hiking, and much more.  We moderately priced this so that families, couples, and friend groups alike can take advantage of it.  We have wood logs on the property for the fireplace that can be chopped and usually there is some already there.  While you feel like your in complete solitude at the top of the south side it's nice to know you have easy access to many amenities (grocery stores, restaurants, movie theater, etc) in the city of Bluefield, VA: located just minutes from the bottom of the northside of the mountain.

You have access to the whole cabin and the trails on the property as well as the trail that goes to my brothers property that can be hiked or used by ATV's.  You also have access to the private community waterfall.

We are in florida but have a property manager that is there for housing needs and/or emergencies.  I pride myself of communication and maximizing your experience.  Email or text me for any details anytime.

The cabin is located inside of a gated, sparsely populated community called cove creek.  Guests have access to the Creek which has trout and a beautiful waterfall.  The city of bluefield and Tazewell are mintues away and have many restaurants, grociery stores, and your basic amenities (there's a walmart...lol).  Also within driving distance are great adventure places like the Hatfield Mccoy ATV Trails, Appalachian Trail for hiking, Winter Place ski resort,  AceRaft for white water and many  parks with waterfalls like pipestem and the cascades.  The property itself is 18 acres and has several trails on it for hiking and atv'ing.

If it’s not snowing any car can be used to get up and down the mountain.  However if more then 2-4 inches snow is in the forecast we highly recommend 4 wheel drive.  Also, the driveway can be tough to get up and down if you aren’t use to driving in the mountains.  I can do it in a Prius as long as it’s not snowing but I have experience. Biggest hint is stick to the left side when going up. There is additional parking at the coldesac on top of the driveway if you want to play it safe

*It takes about 15-20 minutes to go up or down the mountain depending on your vehicle, what your towing, and comfortableness in mountain driving.  
*Hatfielld Mccoy trails are about 15-45 minutes from the bottom depending on which trailhead you access.  as of right now you can not access directly by ATV.
*WinterPlace is 39 miles from the bottom of the mountain and takes about 30 minutes.
*5 miles from Appalachian Trail and can actually view the mountain ridge it passes through from the cabin. 
*"The Back og the Dragon" Trail for motorcycles is close but might have to trailer bikes down the mountain depending if you can ride on the gravel roads.

-you're expected to leave the cabin in clean condition and all trash in bags and dishes washed.  Cleaning lady is not responsible for cleaning up messes, bottles, and other trash left throughout the house and reviews will be given accordingly.
- Special consideration can be given for pets.  Message me individually 
- Accompany children at all times.
- You can smoke outside but please avoid throwing butt's on ground.
- be careful in dry seasons of fires outside.   Put any fire outside completely out with water.   Winds are strong at the top of mountain and can restart your fires that aren’t fully out out and blow embers into dry leaves.   
-  no hunting unless otherwise permitted by owner and properly licensed.
-  no chopping down of live trees or chopping into damaging move trees.   
- lastly, Don't be an idiot.

primaryHost/about:
Christian Couple who loves to enjoy time together in the outdoors! We enjoy meeting new people, and spending time with family and friends.
We are parents, grandparents.. youth leaders, business owners... dog-lovers!
When we get a free moment we take off to WV to ride Four-wheelers with our friends and family. We love to discover new trails, sights, and attractions. 
We are new at hosting, but excited to share our home with others who love to get "out and about"!
sectionedDescription/access: Entire house is available. There is a basement which may contain some owner storage, but is accessible if anything in needed.
sectionedDescription/description:
ATV FRIENDLY: 3 Bedroom, 2 Bath house near War, WV. Easy Access to the new Hatfield McCoy trail system and Outlaw trails. Within 7 minutes to War, WV, and 10 minutes to Berwind Lake to enjoy fishing, swimming pool, and hiking. A 20 minute drive to Welch, WV to enjoy the historic town and movie theatre. Parking out front and in back for trailers. Park and ride! Just off Warrior#16.
Surrounding towns are ATV friendly and you can travel to most restaurants by ATV!

ATV FRIENDLY! Ideal for large family/large group gatherings. Spacious and Cozy cottage-style house with creek behind it, firepit, and charcoal grill. House has large dining and living space for groups to enjoy. Guests may bring air mattresses if more sleep space is needed. (Additional guest fees may apply).  Plenty of parking: in front, left side, and out back.

Entire house is available. There is a basement which may contain some owner storage, but is accessible if anything in needed.

We do not live close by, but we are available by phone or text to answer any questions or give recommendations.

Quiet residential neighborhood; on main road from War to Welch
Excellent location for access to Hatfield McCoy's newest trailhead: the Warrior Trail, and plenty of free local "Outlaw Trails" which lead you through scenic areas of creeks, hills, and small towns.

Roadside parking out front, and beside home. Parking for atv trailer out back with additional parking . Park, unload and ride ATVs anywhere you want to go.

Most restaurants in town close around 6, and the grocery stores close at 8. If you are arriving late, you may need to plan accordingly.

name: Relaxation near the Edge of the Woods
photos/1/caption: View from Road
photos/8/caption: Driveway entrance to Back of house
primaryHost/about:
This is the home we grew up in a small town in southern WV with our parents and grandparents living across the road.  Our family wants to keep our childhood home that holds many memories of grandparents, friends, family, and neighbors as well as our children who grew to love the area.  That was the deciding decision for hosting the airbnb with brothers - Jamie and Troy with help from everyone else.

I am a retired art teacher from Taylor County WV and Lexington Senior High NC. I live in Thomasville NC with my husband who is also from McDowell County WV.  Besides art, I sew and have an online etsy shop.  My brother Troy, has a house-painting business and lives near Bluefield Va.  Our sister Ann, retired from teaching music and her husband have lived in many areas; they are now retired living in White Sulphur Springs WV.  Jamie, my youngest sibling, is a visual artist and works with Urban Tree in Pittsburgh Pa (unique wood furniture).
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
If you enjoy driving on curvy roads, you'll enjoy the trip to everywhere you travel.  Most roads are two lanes so be careful around the blind curves.

Recreation: 
   - 15 minute drive from Berwind Lake: Fishing and Seasonal Pool
   - ATV trails - Warrior trail connection, less than 4 miles to outlaw trail right past Cucumber (can ride atv on road)
   - Near Head and Back of the Dragon
   - Lincolnshire Park - Tazewell Va - pool, trail, lake, kayak/paddle board rentals
   - Cavitts Creek Park, near Tazewell VA
   - Hiking Trails - rough trail behind the house; Berwind Lake; Pinnacle Rock;  for a longer hike, check out the Tazewell County website for Bluefield to Richlands
   - Bluefield City Park, Va - picnic, small train ride, playground
    - Hungry Mother's State Park, Marion Va (about 1 1/2 hr) 

Arts & Cultural Centers
   - Jack Caffrey Arts & Cultural Center, Welch WV
     - Crab Orchard Museum - Tazewell Va about 25 min drive
    - Gary Bowling's House of Art, Bluefield WV
      -Sandy Creek Expedition self guided history tour
    - World War Memorial, Kimball, WV
   - Premier Plane Crash,  memorial 4 miles from Welch
   - McDowell County Sports Hall of Fame, Sterling Restaurant, Welch

** for more info on hiking, ATV trails,  and kayak rentals, visit the meet mcdowell site 

Eats -
- Ol Country Store in Newhall - good biscuits, also registration for ATV
-  War:
Coalfield Cafe 
Coffee Shop
The Owl Drive Inn
Taco Todd’s Taco Hut  
- Tazewell:
     - Bud's (on way to Tazewell)
 - Wendy’s, McDonalds, KFC, Pizza Hut, Hardees and check for locally owned restaurants 

- Welch - Sterling Drive In - you can still get outside service but go inside to see McDowell ‘County Sports Hall of Fame and occasionally local music
sectionedDescription/description:
-Enjoy country living with plenty of privacy and nature around you in southern WV
 -Artists, Writers, Nature/ ATV enthusiasts -hike -outlaw trails connect to Warrior Trail within 4 miles
-Close to: Berwind Lake, Lincolnshire Park, close to Head & Back of the Dragon
-Free Wi-Fi, smart TV, air conditioning - sleeps 7 comfortably, BR, 1 bath; living room, den.  
-Free parking with 2 carports and gravel lots; Fire pit, all-purpose room
Pets welcome with prior approval $40 fee. cohosts Troy & Jamie

- very private location, woods are out back
- main entrance is to the right of the home; code will be sent for the lockbox - we always used the kitchen entrance
- all-purpose room (unheated) has a large table, lots of windows, and is great for crafting, art projects,  games, etc
- Artists/Photographers -lots of nature for inspiration -  the all-purpose room is surrounded by windows and has a large table for a workspace
- Writers - quiet and private
- large outdoor area with basketball hoop, a pond near the fire pit - pond has been low this year;  plenty of wood down - bring your axe if you want to chop more
- 2 carports -  at the lower parking and in back of the house; 
- Fully equipped kitchen, coffee bar set up on buffet - stocked coffee, filters, and tea bags - keurig is available so bring your favorite flavors
- kitchen towels, detergents will be provided 
- bath has soaps, body wash, hand sanitizers, first aid supplies
- two bedrooms specifically, third bedroom was the den that has a daybed and floor space to set up an air mattress, could also be used as a playroom or an office space; there is one locked room for owner storage
- bring sheets, wash cloths, and bath towels
- plenty of bed pillows to choose from; blankets available for use yet you may choose to bring your own bedding
- 'alexa' echo dot in kitchen, lamp on the dresser in the first bedroom is plugged into a smart plug, identified as smart plug 2, should we forget to deactivate while you're there
-Security cameras recently installed (Feb 2023) - we will deactivate while you are a guest 
- large yard and lot;  beautiful daylilies lined the driveway, the white azalea was in full-bloom this spring as well as the irises
- well-water - water softener is used, filter is on the kitchen faucet and a filtered pitcher if you want double-filtered water
-outdoor water pump if you need but please do not leave a muddy yard - there's also a utility sink in the basement that guests may use -for vehicles, there's a car wash (still $1) at the bottom of the road across the RR tracks and bridge
- people are friendly here - check out the local eats (left a list in the guest book)
- 18 acres - rough trails can be hiked but we recommend you carry a walking stick, use bug spray (ticks included), and look out for wildlife; we recently marked a short trail with white paint on the trees, more to come later
-Phones - set up before you arrive to use your internet phone # at the house but you will get cell phone service as you drive within a few miles; house phone can be used for local calls, for your loved ones to call in, or emergencies
- Outlaw trails nearby (there's a rough road trail you could ride above our land if you drive past our house approximately 1/4 mile, it was used by the mining company), approximately 4 miles to Cucumber (Big Creek Mountain Road) is an outlaw trail that will connect to the Warrior trail
- Ol Country Store in Newhall (approximately 3 miles) is an ATV registration station and helpful with info and directions
- ATVs ride on the roads and as long as there's no issues, police allow it
-  Head of the Dragon passes by our home
-   Back of the Dragon is less than 25 minutes in Tazewell, Va


- By booking this home, you are in agreement to the following: 
 
      People	other than those in the Guest party set for above may not stay overnight in the property.  Any other person in the property is the sole responsibility of the Guest.

     This home is privately owned, the owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities.  Be aware of safety precautions -  there is a pond and a covered opening to the stream running through near the firepit and near the lower carport.

     The Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the Guest or any person with the Guest.

     By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise.

      Renter agrees that any liability assigned by any court of law shall be limited to the amount of the rental contract.

If you enjoy driving on curvy roads, you'll enjoy the trip to everywhere you travel.  Most roads are two lanes so be careful around the blind curves.

Recreation: 
   - 15 minute drive from Berwind Lake: Fishing and Seasonal Pool
   - ATV trails - Warrior trail connection, less than 4 miles to outlaw trail right past Cucumber (can ride atv on road)
   - Near Head and Back of the Dragon
   - Lincolnshire Park - Tazewell Va - pool, trail, lake, kayak/paddle board rentals
   - Cavitts Creek Park, near Tazewell VA
   - Hiking Trails - rough trail behind the house; Berwind Lake; Pinnacle Rock;  for a longer hike, check out the Tazewell County website for Bluefield to Richlands
   - Bluefield City Park, Va - picnic, small train ride, playground
    - Hungry Mother's State Park, Marion Va (about 1 1/2 hr) 

Arts & Cultural Centers
   - Jack Caffrey Arts & Cultural Center, Welch WV
     - Crab Orchard Museum - Tazewell Va about 25 min drive
    - Gary Bowling's House of Art, Bluefield WV
      -Sandy Creek Expedition self guided history tour
    - World War Memorial, Kimball, WV
   - Premier Plane Crash,  memorial 4 miles from Welch
   - McDowell County Sports Hall of Fame, Sterling Restaurant, Welch

** for more info on hiking, ATV trails,  and kayak rentals, visit the meet mcdowell site 

Eats -
- Ol Country Store in Newhall - good biscuits, also registration for ATV
-  War:
Coalfield Cafe 
Coffee Shop
The Owl Drive Inn
Taco Todd’s Taco Hut  
- Tazewell:
     - Bud's (on way to Tazewell)
 - Wendy’s, McDonalds, KFC, Pizza Hut, Hardees and check for locally owned restaurants 

- Welch - Sterling Drive In - you can still get outside service but go inside to see McDowell ‘County Sports Hall of Fame and occasionally local music

There is a local contact name (Cindy) on the buffet should guests need anything immediately or call me and I will contact her.

Private setting with the woods behind you and beside you.  Pond on the lower lot with the fire pit.  One neighbor across the street.

The Warrior Trail is 10 miles from our house, parking is at the Trailhead office through the town of War (about another mile from the trail entrance.  The outlaw trails do not show up on the trail maps, we drew one to leave at the house for New Haven Road (hopefully the last riders left it). The other access is below Cucumber and called Big Creek Mountain Road. New Haven Rd is around 4 miles from our lodge, maybe 1/4 from the store and Big Creek Mountain Rd is another couple miles.  I've been told this is the map that will show you all trails...search bob t maps

Rt 16  will lead you to:
Left turn:
- Ol Country Store in Newhall where you can get food, permits and maps
- access to one of the trails past Brewster's Oil 
- Restaurants and stores in War, WV (southern most WV city)
- Welch WV - art/historical center, movie theater
Right turn:
- Bishop Hillbilly Mart - food, gas
- Adria - gas, food
- Tazewell Va - grocery stores - Grants, FoodLion; 
       Parks - Lincolnshire, Cavitt's Creek, Lake Witten;
       Back of the Dragon 
       Local shops:  Between Friends; Silk Bloomers, consignment shops

Rt 11 is Canebrake Mountain Road - turn left for a country drive to Berwind Lakes

---Guests will be provided blankets/quilts, pillows, and kitchen towels.  Guests will provide their own sheets and bath towels.  Dish detergent, hand soaps, paper towels, bathroom tissue, and hand sanitizer are provided.
---its actually a 3BR home but one is presently locked for family storage and the den has an accordion door to give privacy as a 3rd bedroom
---Plenty of downed wood to be found for the firepit, might want to bring an ax or saw
---Hunters - if you’re coming during hunting seasons - there are 2 gun racks on the walls for your convenience
---Den area:  - there’s a daybed that sleeps one, a monitor that could be used with your device; there’s a few books and games
---The sofas both have pull-out beds, the love seat is more comfortable than the full but kids don't seem to notice.  The queen air mattress does fit in the den floor on the desk side
---Great views for artists and the all-purpose room would be a great place for painting - lots of windows
---Writers would enjoy the pace and quiet

-Free Wi-Fi, smart TV, air conditioning - sleeps 7 comfortably, BR, 1 bath; living room, den.  
-Free parking with 2 carports and gravel lots; Fire pit, all-purpose room
Pets welcome with prior approval $40 fee. cohosts Troy & Jamie
sectionedDescription/transit:
Rt 16  will lead you to:
Left turn:
- Ol Country Store in Newhall where you can get food, permits and maps
- access to one of the trails past Brewster's Oil 
- Restaurants and stores in War, WV (southern most WV city)
- Welch WV - art/historical center, movie theater
Right turn:
- Bishop Hillbilly Mart - food, gas
- Adria - gas, food
- Tazewell Va - grocery stores - Grants, FoodLion; 
       Parks - Lincolnshire, Cavitt's Creek, Lake Witten;
       Back of the Dragon 
       Local shops:  Between Friends; Silk Bloomers, consignment shops

Rt 11 is Canebrake Mountain Road - turn left for a country drive to Berwind Lakes

name: Mountain Momma - clean and convenient!
photos/4/caption: Seating for 6, wings fold down for more space around the room.
photos/10/caption: Extra towels, cleaning products, linens available in the living room closet.
primaryHost/about: I am a husband, a father of four and I enjoy good books.  We are a pretty relaxed family and we are very active in our community in southern West Virginia.  Please contact me with any concerns.
sectionedDescription/access: It’s all yours!
sectionedDescription/description:
Mountain Momma is an above-garage apartment in Iaeger, WV.  We are located just a few miles from the Outlaw Trails trailhead at Wilmore Dam, and 12 miles from the Hatfield McCoy trailhead in Welch.  Other nearby HM trails are in Gilbert and War.   The newly-remodeled home offers two bedrooms and one bathroom, with additional sleeping in the living room.   The kitchen has concrete countertops and soft-close cabinets.  A Dollar General store is 1/4 mile away, and we have parking for ATV's.

All of the work on this apartment was completed by 120+ volunteers from 10+ states in 2018-2019.  As Covid-19 has ended the mentoring internship program typically hosted in this housing, we are turning over a new leaf.

It’s all yours!

Our family lives adjacent to this building in our split-level home.  We have young kids who are very friendly and polite!  We will give you your space but are available for whatever you might need.  Our heart is to serve you, see to it you enjoy the stay and earn your 5-star review

We are on Route 52 in Iaeger, the main road in our county.  This is a safe small-town place.

Parking is across the street in an open field for vehicles with trailers.  If no trailer, use the driveway if it's convenient for you.

primaryHost/about: Hi! I own 2 Airbnb loft apartments in downtown Tazewell, VA. It brings me great joy to host visitors here in beautiful T-Town. I work with coal impacted communities in Southwest VA on Economic Development projects. I can be your personal tourism assistant while you’re visiting Tazewell, just ask!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Full access to entire apartment and balcony.
sectionedDescription/description:
Conveniently located on Main Street Tazewell, you’re within walking distance to 3 full service downtown restaurants, a coffee shop, brewery, boutiques, an art gallery and more! Spacious apartment, featuring a king suite and a second bedroom with a full sized bed. Pull out the futon for additional sleepers, and there’s a full sized couch as well. Kitchen features new appliances and everything you need to enjoy home cooked meals during your stay. Laundry room with washer and dryer for your use.

Built in 1878, this building was the original home to Clinch Valley News. This second story apartment is overflowing with charm & character. Guests have access to a full living room, featuring a sofa, chair and smart TV. An 8 person dining table, full kitchen, bathroom, king suite with a futon and a smart TV, and a full size bed in the second bedroom with a walk in closet.

Full access to entire apartment and balcony.

I am a phone call or text away!

Main Street Tazewell is home to a variety of restaurants and retail shops and is the gateway to the scenic Back of the Dragon. Parking is located in the back of the building, we share a parking lot with the Sheriff’s Department and the Library. There is plenty of safe and private parking.

Parking and entrance to the apartment is located in the back of the building. Turn onto Marion Ave from Main Street and take the left hand turn into the parking lot. The entrance is the white door. You will be given an access code to unlock the door.

WiFi, off street parking, trash pick up, washer and dryer inside apartment.

additionalHouseRules:
Not suitable for infants and young toddlers due to safety issues, example, the home has stairs and there are no baby gates or cribs yet.

We ask, before checking out please leave the house as you found it. Please clean up what you have used. Thank you for being our guest.

1. Clean out the refrigerator and microwave then put the dishes in the dishwasher and please start it. Wipe down anything in the kitchen that has been used. 

2.  Put dirty towels in the hamper in the washroom. 

3. Sweep if needed, And take out the garbage to trash cans outside. 

4. Do Not remove bed sheets or spread. The housekeeper will remove for laundry.
 
5. Turn off heat/ air conditioner and lights in each room. 
  
6. Text CHECKED OUT through Airbnb App

Thank you for coming!
